ffaframework coverage - 96.06%

  • Files
  • Source
1 
#' Plot L-Moment Ratio Diagram
2 
#'
3 
#' @description
4 
#' Generates a plot of L-moment ratios with the L-skewness on the x-axis and L-kurtosis
5 
#' on the y-axis. Plots the sample and log-sample L-moment ratios alongside the theoretical
6 
#' L-moment ratios for a set of candidate distributions. If the selection method is
7 
#' \link{ld.selection} or \link{lk.selection}, the plot will include a small inset around
8 
#' the L-moment ratios of the recommended distribution.
9 
#'
10 
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.
11 
#'
12 
#' @param results List; output of \link{ld.selection}, \link{lk.selection},
13 
#'   or \link{z.selection}.
14 
#'
15 
#' @return \code{ggplot}; plot object containing the L-moment ratio diagram, with:
16 
#' - L-moment ratio curves for each 3-parameter distribution.
17 
#' - Points for the L-moment ratios of each 2-parameter distribution.
18 
#' - Sample and log-sample L-moment ratio \eqn{(t_3, t_4)} points.
19 
#'
20 
#' @seealso \link{ld.selection}, \link{lk.selection}, \link{z.selection}
21 
#'
22 
#' @examples
23 
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)
24 
#' results <- ld.selection(data)
25 
#' lmom.plot(data, results)
26 
#'
27 
#' @import ggplot2
28 
#' @importFrom grDevices pdf
29 
#' @export
30 

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
lmom.plot <- function(data, results) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
	# Get method name from the results

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    3x
                    
                      
	method <- results$method

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
	# Create dataframes for the sample L-moments

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    3x
                    
                      
	reg_sample_t3 = lmom.sample(data)[3]

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    3x
                    
                      
	reg_sample_t4 = lmom.sample(data)[4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    3x
                    
                      
	log_sample_t3 = lmom.sample(log(data))[3]

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    3x
                    
                      
	log_sample_t4 = lmom.sample(log(data))[4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    3x
                    
                      
	reg_lm <- data.frame(x = reg_sample_t3, y = reg_sample_t4)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    3x
                    
                      
	log_lm <- data.frame(x = log_sample_t4, y = log_sample_t4)

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
	# Generate a dataframe with the moments for each distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    3x
                    
                      
	dlm <- list()

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    3x
                    
                      
	for (model in c("GUM", "NOR", "LNO", "GEV", "GLO", "GNO", "PE3", "LP3", "WEI")) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    27x
                    
                      
		info <- models.info(model)

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    27x
                    
                      
		if (info$n.params == 2) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    9x
                    
                      
			dm <- lmrxxx(model, c(0, 1))

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    9x
                    
                      
			dlm[[model]] = data.frame(x = dm[3], y = dm[4])

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
		else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
			# Generate a sequence of parameter sets to pass to a 3-parameter distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    18x
                    
                      
			k_seq <- seq(info$k.bounds[1], info$k.bounds[2], 0.001)

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    18x
                    
                      
			params <- lapply(k_seq, function(i) c(0, 1, i))

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
			# Get a matrix of likelihood moment ratios for each parameter set in params

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    18x
                    
                      
			lmr <- lapply(params, function(p) suppressWarnings(lmrxxx(model, p)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    18x
                    
                      
			lmr <- do.call(rbind, lmr)

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
			# Return the t3 and t4 values as a dataframe

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    18x
                    
                      
			df = data.frame(x = lmr[, 3], y = lmr[, 4]) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    18x
                    
                      
			dlm[[model]] <- df[(!is.na(df$x) & !is.na(df$y)), ]

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
	# Initilaize the legend information

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    3x
                    
                      
	labels <- c("Sample", "Log-Sample", "GEV/GUM", "GLO", "GNO/NOR/LNO", "PE3/LP3", "WEI")

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    3x
                    
                      
	colors <- c("#000000", "#000000", "#e69f00", "#56b4e9", "#009e73", "#0072b2", "#d55e00")

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    3x
                    
                      
	shapes <- c(24, 15, 16, NA, 16, NA, NA)

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
	# Define labels for the plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    3x
                    
                      
	x_label <- expression("L-skewness (" * tau[3] * ")")

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    3x
                    
                      
	y_label <- expression("L-kurtosis (" * tau[4] * ")")

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    3x
                    
                      
	title <- paste(method, "Model Selection", sep = " ")

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
	# Generate the plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    3x
                    
                      
	p1 <- ggplot(mapping = aes(x = .data$x, y = .data$y)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    3x
                    
                      
		geom_line(data = dlm$GEV, aes(color = "3"), linewidth = 1) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    3x
                    
                      
		geom_line(data = dlm$GLO, aes(color = "4"), linewidth = 1) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    3x
                    
                      
		geom_line(data = dlm$GNO, aes(color = "5"), linewidth = 1) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    3x
                    
                      
		geom_line(data = dlm$PE3, aes(color = "6"), linewidth = 1) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    3x
                    
                      
		geom_line(data = dlm$WEI, aes(color = "7"), linewidth = 1) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    3x
                    
                      
		geom_point(data = dlm$GUM, aes(color = "3"), shape = 16, size = 4) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    3x
                    
                      
		geom_point(data = dlm$NOR, aes(color = "5"), shape = 16, size = 4) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    3x
                    
                      
		geom_point(data = reg_lm, aes(color = "1"), shape = 24, size = 5, fill = "black") +

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    3x
                    
                      
		geom_point(data = log_lm, aes(color = "2"), shape = 15, size = 5) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    3x
                    
                      
		scale_color_manual(labels = labels, values = colors) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    3x
                    
                      
		guides(color = guide_legend(override.aes = list(shape = shapes))) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    3x
                    
                      
		labs(x = x_label, y = y_label, color = "Legend", title = title) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    3x
                    
                      
		coord_fixed(ratio = 2, xlim = c(-0.7, 0.7), ylim = c(0, 0.7))

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      
	# Add the theme

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    3x
                    
                      
	p1 <- add_theme(add_scales(p1))

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
	# If the method is l-distance or l-kurtosis, draw a line to show the distance

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    3x
                    
                      
	if (method == "L-distance" | method == "L-kurtosis") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      
		# Get the sample point with the shortest distance from a distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    2x
                    
                      
		point <- if (results$recommendation %in% c("LNO", "LP3")) log_lm else reg_lm

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      
		# Get the recommended distribbution

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    2x
                    
                      
		df <- dlm[[results$recommendation]]

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      
		# Get the closest point on the (t3, t4) curve (L-distance)

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    2x
                    
                      
		if (method == "L-distance") { 

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    1x
                    
                      
			df$distance <- sqrt((df$x - point$x)^2 + (df$y - point$y)^2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    1x
                    
                      
			df <- df[which.min(df$distance), ]

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      
		# Or get the point with the same t3 value (L-kurtosis)

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    
                    
                      
		else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    1x
                    
                      
			df <- df[which.min(abs(df$x - point$x)), ]

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    1x
                    
                      
			df$distance <- abs(df$y - point$y)

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    
                    
                      
		# Dynamically set the radius of the magnified section

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    2x
                    
                      
		r <- df$distance * 3

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    
                    
                      
		# Draw the inset plot: same layers, zoomed to [x +/- r, y +/- r]

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    2x
                    
                      
		p2 <- p1 +

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    2x
                    
                      
			geom_segment(data = point, aes(xend = df$x, yend = df$y)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    2x
                    
                      
			coord_cartesian(

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    2x
                    
                      
				xlim = c(point$x - r, point$x + r),

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    2x
                    
                      
				ylim = c(point$y - r, point$y + r)

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    
                    
                      
		    ) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    2x
                    
                      
			theme_void() + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    2x
                    
                      
			theme(

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    2x
                    
                      
				legend.position = "none",

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    2x
                    
                      
				panel.border = element_rect(colour = "black", fill = NA, linewidth = 1),

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    2x
                    
                      
				plot.background = element_rect(colour = NA, fill = "white")

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    
                    
                      
			)

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    
                    
                      
		# Turn the inset plot into a grob

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    2x
                    
                      
		pdf(nullfile())

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    2x
                    
                      
		p2_grob <- ggplotGrob(p2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    
                    
                      
		# Place inset on main plot using annotation_custom()

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    2x
                    
                      
		p1 <- p1 +

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    2x
                    
                      
			geom_segment(data = point, aes(xend = 0.25, yend = 0.35)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    2x
                    
                      
			geom_segment(data = point, aes(xend = -0.25, yend = 0.35)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    2x
                    
                      
		    annotation_custom(

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    2x
                    
                      
				grob = p2_grob,

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    2x
                    
                      
				xmin = -0.25, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    2x
                    
                      
				xmax = 0.25,

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    2x
                    
                      
				ymin = 0.35, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    2x
                    
                      
				ymax = 0.60

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    
                    
                      
			)

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    3x
                    
                      
	p1

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Decompose Annual Maximum Streamflow Data

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Removes trends in the means and/or variances of annual maximum streamflow (AMS)

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' data using Sen’s trend estimator and a moving‐window estimator of the variance. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' Four scenarios are supported:

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' 1. No trend. The data is returned unmodified.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' 2. Trend in means only.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' 3. Trend in variance only.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' 4. Trends in both means and variance.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @param years Numeric; a vector of years with the same length as `data`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @param signature Character (1); Indicates trend(s) to remove.  Must be one of:

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - `NULL`: Do not remove any trends.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' - `"10"`: Remove linear trend in the mean.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' - `"01"`: Remove linear trend in the variance.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' - `"11"`: Remove trends in both the mean and variance.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' Internally, the function does the following:

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' 1. If `signature == NULL`, returns `data` without modification.

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' 2. Constructs a `covariate` based on `years` using the formula `(years - 1900) / 100`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' 3. If `signature == "10"`, fits Sen’s trend estimator to `data` and `covariate`

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'    and removes the fitted linear mean trend.

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' 4. If `signature == "01"`, computes moving‐window variances using \link{mw.variance}, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'    fits Sen’s trend estimator to those variances, and rescales the series to remove 

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'    trends in the variance.

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' 5. If `signature == "11"`, applies (3) then (4) sequentially.

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' 6. Ensures all returned values are greater than 1 by shifting the decomposed data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Numeric; a vector with the same length as `data` and `years` containing 

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' the decomposed AMS data with the specified trend(s) removed.

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{mw.variance}, \link{sens.trend}

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' ams.decomposition(data, years, "10")

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
ams.decomposition <- function(data, years, signature) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
	# Replace the 'year' column in df with the covariate

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    21x
                    
                      
	covariate <- get.covariates(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
	# Signature NULL: no trend.

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    21x
                    
                      
	if (is.null(signature)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    6x
                    
                      
		return (data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
	# Signature "10": Trend in the AMS means.

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    21x
                    
                      
	else if (signature == "10") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    6x
                    
                      
		model <- sens.trend(data, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    6x
                    
                      
		decomposed <- data - (covariate * model$sens.slope)

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
	# Signature "01": Trend in the AMS variance.

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    21x
                    
                      
	else if (signature == "01") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
		# Get the moving window SD estimates

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    4x
                    
                      
		variance <- mw.variance(data, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
		# Run Sen's trend estimator and decompose the data

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    4x
                    
                      
        model <- sens.trend(variance$std, variance$years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    4x
                    
                      
		c0 <- model$sens.intercept

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    4x
                    
                      
		c1 <- model$sens.slope

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    4x
                    
                      
        gt <- ((c1 * covariate) + c0) / c0

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    4x
                    
                      
		mu <- mean(data, na.rm = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    4x
                    
                      
        decomposed <- mu + ((data - mu) / gt)

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
	# Signature "11": Trend in AMS means and variance.

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    21x
                    
                      
	else if (signature == "11") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
		# Run Sen's trend estimator and remove the trend in the means

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    4x
                    
                      
		model_means <- sens.trend(data, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    4x
                    
                      
		decomposed <- data - (covariate * model_means$sens.slope)

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
		# Get the moving window SD estimates

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    4x
                    
                      
		df_variance <- mw.variance(decomposed, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
		# Run Sen's trend estimator and decompose the data

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    4x
                    
                      
        model_variance <- sens.trend(df_variance$std, df_variance$year)

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    4x
                    
                      
		c0 <- model_variance$sens.intercept

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    4x
                    
                      
		c1 <- model_variance$sens.slope

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    4x
                    
                      
        gt <- ((c1 * covariate) + c0) / c0

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    4x
                    
                      
		mu <- mean(decomposed, na.rm = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    4x
                    
                      
        decomposed <- mu + ((decomposed - mu) / gt)

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
	# Otherwise return an error

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
	else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    1x
                    
                      
		stop("Error: 'signature' must be NULL, '10', '01', or '11'.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
	# Enforce positivity

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    14x
                    
                      
	if (sum(decomposed < 0, na.rm = TRUE) > 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    3x
                    
                      
		decomposed <- decomposed - min(decomposed) + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      
	# Return decomposed data

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    14x
                    
                      
	decomposed

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Sen's Trend Estimator

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Computes Sen's trend estimator for a univariate time series.

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @param years Numeric; a vector of years with the same length as `data`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @param quiet Logical (1); if FALSE, prints a summary of results (default is TRUE).

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List; the estimated trend:

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' - `sens.slope`: Median slope of all pairwise data-year combinations.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' - `sens.intercept`: Median intercept estimate of the fitted line.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - `residuals`: Vector of residuals between observed and fitted values.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `msg`: Character string summarizing the results.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' Sen's slope estimator is a robust, non-parametric trend estimator computed from the median

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' of all pairwise slopes between data points. The corresponding intercept is taken as the

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' median of residual-corrected values. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @references

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' Sen, P.K. (1968). Estimates of the regression coefficient based on Kendall's tau.

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' \emph{Journal of the American Statistical Association}, 63(324), 1379–1389. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{runs.test}

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' sens.trend(data, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats median

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
sens.trend <- function(data, years, quiet = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the length of data for convenience

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    30x
                    
                      
	n <- length(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
	# Convert the years into covariates

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    30x
                    
                      
	covariate <- get.covariates(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute all pairwise slopes

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    30x
                    
                      
	slopes <- c()

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    30x
                    
                      
	for (i in 1:(n-1)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    2305x
                    
                      
		for (j in (i+1):n) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    109201x
                    
                      
			m <- (data[j] - data[i]) / (covariate[j] - covariate[i])

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    109201x
                    
                      
			slopes <- c(slopes, m)

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the estimate for the slope

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    30x
                    
                      
	sens_slope <- median(slopes, na.rm = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the estimate for the intercept

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    30x
                    
                      
	intercepts <- data - (sens_slope * covariate)

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    30x
                    
                      
	sens_intercept <- median(intercepts, na.rm =  TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the predicted AMS values and the residuals

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    30x
                    
                      
	predicted_data <- sens_intercept + (sens_slope * covariate)

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    30x
                    
                      
	residuals <- data - predicted_data

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
	# Print the results of Sen's trend estimator

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    30x
                    
                      
	m <- round(sens_slope, 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    30x
                    
                      
	b <- round(sens_intercept, 2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    30x
                    
                      
	msg <- sprintf("Estimated trend: y = %fx + %f.", m, b)

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    30x
                    
                      
	if (!quiet) message(msg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the results as a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    30x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    30x
                    
                      
		sens.slope = sens_slope,

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    30x
                    
                      
		sens.intercept = sens_intercept,

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    30x
                    
                      
		residuals = residuals,

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    30x
                    
                      
		msg = msg

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Mann–Kendall Trend Test

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Performs the Mann–Kendall trend test on a numeric vector to detect the presence 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' of a monotonic trend (increasing or decreasing) over time. The test is non-parametric 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' and accounts for tied observations in the data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @param alpha Numeric (1); the significance level (default is 0.05).

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @param quiet Logical (1); if FALSE, prints a summary of results (default is TRUE).

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List; the test results:

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - `s.statistic`: The raw Mann–Kendall test statistic \eqn{S}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `s.variance`: The variance of the test statistic under the null hypothesis.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - `p.value`: The p-value associated with the two-sided hypothesis test.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reject`: Logical. TRUE if the null hypothesis of no trend is rejected at `alpha`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - `msg`: A character string summarizing the result (printed if `quiet = FALSE`).

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' The statistic \eqn{S} is computed as the sum over all pairs \eqn{i < j} of the sign of the

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' difference \eqn{x_j - x_i}. Ties are explicitly accounted for when calculating the variance of

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' \eqn{S}, using grouped frequencies of tied observations. The test statistic \eqn{Z} is then 

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' computed based on the sign and magnitude of \eqn{S}, and the p-value is derived from the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' standard normal distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{bbmk.test}

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' mk.test(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats pnorm

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
mk.test <- function(data, alpha = 0.05, quiet = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
	# Assign a variable to number of data points for convenience

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    8x
                    
                      
	n <- length(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the test statistic S by iterating through all pairs of values in data

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    8x
                    
                      
	s <- 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    8x
                    
                      
	for (i in 1:(n-1)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    759x
                    
                      
		for (j in (i+1):n) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    36550x
                    
                      
			s = s + sign(data[j] - data[i])

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
	# Identify tied groups and find the number of elements in each group

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    8x
                    
                      
	freqs <- table(data)        

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    8x
                    
                      
	ties <- freqs[freqs > 1]    

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    8x
                    
                      
	g <- length(ties)           

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    8x
                    
                      
	tp <- as.vector(ties)       

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the the S-variance including the contribution from groups

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    8x
                    
                      
	group_sum <- sum(tp * (tp - 1) * (2 * tp + 5))

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    8x
                    
                      
	s_variance <- (1 / 18) * ((n * (n-1) * (2 * n + 5)) - group_sum)

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the normalized test statistic Z

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    8x
                    
                      
	z <- if (s > 0) { 

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    4x
                    
                      
		(s - 1) / sqrt(s_variance) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    8x
                    
                      
	} else if (s == 0) { 

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    !
                    
                      
		0 

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
	} else { 

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    4x
                    
                      
		(s + 1) / sqrt(s_variance) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the p-value for a two-sided test

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    8x
                    
                      
	p_value <- 2 * pnorm(abs(z), lower.tail=FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine whether we reject or fail to reject based on p_value and alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    8x
                    
                      
	reject <- (p_value <= alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
	# Print the results of the test

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    8x
                    
                      
	msg <- test_message(

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    8x
                    
                      
		"Mann-Kendall",

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    8x
                    
                      
		reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    8x
                    
                      
		p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    8x
                    
                      
		alpha,

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    8x
                    
                      
		"evidence of a monotonic trend",

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    8x
                    
                      
		"NO evidence of a monotonic trend"

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    8x
                    
                      
	if (!quiet) message(msg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the results of the test as a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    8x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    8x
                    
                      
		s.statistic = s,

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    8x
                    
                      
		s.variance = s_variance,

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    8x
                    
                      
		p.value = p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    8x
                    
                      
		reject = reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    8x
                    
                      
		msg = msg

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Helper Function for Quantile Functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' A helper function used by \link{qnt-functions}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
