                    129
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    120885x
                    
                      
		F1 <-  5.1533299

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    120885x
                    
                      
		F2 <-  7.1425260

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    120885x
                    
                      
		F3 <-  1.9745056

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    120885x
                    
                      
		G1 <-  2.1235833

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    120885x
                    
                      
		G2 <-  4.1670213

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    120885x
                    
                      
		G3 <-  3.1925299

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    120885x
                    
                      
		H1 <-  9.0551443

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    120885x
                    
                      
		H2 <-  2.6649995e1

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    120885x
                    
                      
		H3 <-  2.6193668e1

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    
                    
                      
		# Reparameterize the distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    120885x
                    
                      
		a <- 4 / k^2

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    120885x
                    
                      
		b <- s * abs(k) / 2

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    120885x
                    
                      
		x <- u - (2 * s / abs(k))

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute the L-moments

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    120885x
                    
                      
		l1 <- x + (a * b)

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    120885x
                    
                      
		l2 <- (pi^-0.5) * b * exp(lgamma(a + 0.5) - lgamma(a))

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    120885x
                    
                      
		if (a >= 1) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    24783x
                    
                      
			t3 <- a^-0.5 * (A0 + A1 * a^-1 + A2 * a^-2 + A3 * a^-3) / (1 + B1 * a^-1 + B2 * a^-2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    24783x
                    
                      
			t4 <- (C0 + C1 * a^-1 + C2 * a^-2 + C3 * a^-3) / (1 + D1 * a^-1 + D2 * a^-2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    
                    
                      
		} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    96102x
                    
                      
			t3 <- (1 + E1 * a + E2 * a^2 + E3 * a^3) / (1 + F1 * a + F2 * a^2 + F3 * a^3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    96102x
                    
                      
			t4 <- (1 + G1 * a + G2 * a^2 + G3 * a^3) / (1 + H1 * a + H2 * a^2 + H3 * a^3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    
                    
                      
		# Flip the sign of t3 if k < 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    120885x
                    
                      
		if (k < 0) t3 <- -t3

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    164
                    260887x
                    
                      
	else if (model == "WEI") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    165
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    166
                    
                    
                      
		# Reparameterize

                    		
                  

                  

                    167
                    54492x
                    
                      
		ug <- 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    168
                    54492x
                    
                      
		sg <- s / k

                    		
                  

                  

                    169
                    54492x
                    
                      
		kg <- 1 / k

                    		
                  

                  

                    170
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    171
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute L-moments for GEV

                    		
                  

                  

                    172
                    54492x
                    
                      
		l1g <- ug + sg * (1 - gamma(1 + kg)) / kg

                    		
                  

                  

                    173
                    54492x
                    
                      
		l2g <- sg * (1 - 2^-kg) * gamma(1 + kg) / kg

                    		
                  

                  

                    174
                    54492x
                    
                      
		t3g <- 2 * (1 - 3^-kg) / (1 - 2^-kg) - 3

                    		
                  

                  

                    175
                    54492x
                    
                      
		t4g <- (5 * (1 - 4^-kg) - 10 * (1 - 3^-kg) + 6 * (1 - 2^-kg)) / (1 - 2^-kg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    176
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    177
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute L-moments for Weibull

                    		
                  

                  

                    178
                    54492x
                    
                      
		l1 <- u + s - l1g

                    		
                  

                  

                    179
                    54492x
                    
                      
		l2 <- l2g

                    		
                  

                  

                    180
                    54492x
                    
                      
		t3 <- -t3g

                    		
                  

                  

                    181
                    54492x
                    
                      
		t4 <- t4g

                    		
                  

                  

                    182
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    183
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    184
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    185
                    
                    
                      
	# Return results as a vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    186
                    260887x
                    
                      
	c(l1, l2, t3, t4)

                    		
                  

                  

                    187
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    188
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Helper Function for L-moments Parameter Estimation

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' A helper function used by \link{pel-functions}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' @param model Character; `GUM`, `NOR`, `LNO`, `GEV`, `GLO`, `GNO`,

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'   `PE3`, `LP3`, or `WEI`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Numeric; a vector of parameters. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' - Numeric (2) if `model` is `GUM`, `NOR`, or `LNO`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' - Numeric (3) if `model` is `GEV`, `GLO`, `GNO`, `PE3`, `LP3`, or `WEI`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @references

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' Hosking, J.R.M. & Wallis, J.R., 1997. Regional frequency analysis: an approach based 

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' on L-Moments. Cambridge University Press, New York, USA.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' pelxxx("PE3", data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
pelxxx <- function(model, data) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the correct L-moments based on the model

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    183147x
                    
                      
	moments <- if (model == "LP3") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    11012x
                    
                      
		lmom.sample(log(data))

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
	} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    172135x
                    
                      
		lmom.sample(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
	# Unpack the L-moments

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    183147x
                    
                      
	l1 <- moments[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    183147x
                    
                      
	l2 <- moments[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    183147x
                    
                      
	t3 <- moments[3]

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    183147x
                    
                      
	t4 <- moments[4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
	# NOTE: -digamma(1) is Euler's constant (~0.5772)

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    183147x
                    
                      
	if (model == "GUM") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    21016x
                    
                      
		s <- l2 / log(2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    21016x
                    
                      
		u <- l1	+ digamma(1) * s

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    21016x
                    
                      
		k <- NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    183147x
                    
                      
	else if (model == "NOR") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    21012x
                    
                      
		u <- l1

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    21012x
                    
                      
		s <- l2 * sqrt(pi)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    21012x
                    
                      
		k <- NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
	# NOTE: Copied from MATLAB, not sure why we use this formula.

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    183147x
                    
                      
	else if (model == "LNO") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    21012x
                    
                      
		s <- sqrt(2) * qnorm((1 + (l2 / l1)) / 2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    21012x
                    
                      
        u <- log(l1) - s^2 / 2

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    21012x
                    
                      
		k <- NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    183147x
                    
                      
	else if (model == "GEV") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    38043x
                    
                      
		c <- (2 / (3 + t3)) - (log(2) / log(3))

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    38043x
                    
                      
		k <- -7.8590 * c - 2.9554 * c^2

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    38043x
                    
                      
		s <- (l2 * -k) / ((1 - 2^k) * gamma(1 - k))

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    38043x
                    
                      
		u <- l1 + s * (1 - gamma(1 - k)) / k

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    183147x
                    
                      
	else if (model == "GLO") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    20011x
                    
                      
		k <- -t3

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    20011x
                    
                      
		s <- l2 * sin(k * pi) / (k * pi)

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    20011x
                    
                      
		u <- l1 - s * ((1 / k) - (pi / sin(k * pi)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    183147x
                    
                      
	else if (model == "GNO") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
		# Define coefficients

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    21013x
                    
                      
     	A0 <-  0.20466534e1

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    21013x
                    
                      
 		A1 <- -0.36544371e1

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    21013x
                    
                      
	 	A2 <-  0.18396733e1

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    21013x
                    
                      
		A3 <- -0.20360244

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    21013x
                    
                      
      	B1 <- -0.20182173e1

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    21013x
                    
                      
		B2 <-  0.12420401e1

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    21013x
                    
                      
		B3 <- -0.21741801

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute shape parameter

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    21013x
                    
                      
		tt <- t3^2

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    21013x
                    
                      
        k = -t3 * (A0 + tt * (A1 + tt *(A2 + tt * A3))) / (1 + tt * (B1 + tt * (B2 + tt * B3)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      
		# Define the error function erf(z)

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    21013x
                    
                      
		erf <- function(z) 2 * pnorm(z * sqrt(2)) - 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute location and scale parameters

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    21013x
                    
                      
        x = exp(k^2 / 2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    21013x
                    
                      
        s = l2 * k / (x * erf(k / 2))

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    21013x
                    
                      
        u = l1 + s * (x - 1) / k

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
	# NOTE: Computation for PE3 and LP3 is identical, just with different sample L-moments

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    183147x
                    
                      
	else if (model == "PE3" | model == "LP3") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
		# Define constants for numerical approximation

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    21026x
                    
                      
		A1 <- 0.2906

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    21026x
                    
                      
		B1 <- 0.1882

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    21026x
                    
                      
		B2 <- 0.0442

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    21026x
                    
                      
		C1 <- 0.36067

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    21026x
                    
                      
		C2 <- 0.59567

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    21026x
                    
                      
		C3 <- 0.25361

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    21026x
                    
                      
		D1 <- 2.78861

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    21026x
                    
                      
		D2 <- 2.56096

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    21026x
                    
                      
		D3 <- 0.77045

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute z and a

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    21026x
                    
                      
		a <- if (0 < abs(t3) & abs(t3) < (1 / 3)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    20716x
                    
                      
			z <- 3 * pi * t3^2

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    20716x
                    
                      
			(1 + A1 * z) / (z + B1 * z^2 + B2 * z^3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    
                    
                      
		} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    310x
                    
                      
			z <- 1 - t3

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    310x
                    
                      
			(C1 * z - C2 * z^2 + C3 * z^3) / (1 - D1 * z + D2 * z^2 - D3 * z^3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute parameter estimates

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    21026x
                    
                      
		u <- l1

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    21026x
                    
                      
		s <- l2 * pi^0.5 * a^0.5 * exp(lgamma(a) - lgamma(a + 0.5))

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    21026x
                    
                      
		k <- 2 * a^-0.5 * sign(t3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    183147x
                    
                      
	else if (model == "WEI") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    
                    
                      
		# Estimate GEV parameters, flipping the sign of l1, t3

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    20014x
                    
                      
		c <- (2 / (3 - t3)) - (log(2) / log(3))

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    20014x
                    
                      
		kg <- 7.8590 * c + 2.9554 * c^2

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    20014x
                    
                      
		sg <- (l2 * kg) / ((1 - 2^-kg) * gamma(1 + kg))

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    20014x
                    
                      
		ug <- -l1 - sg * (1 - gamma(1 + kg)) / kg

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute parameters

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    20014x
                    
                      
		k <- 1 / kg

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    20014x
                    
                      
		s <- sg / kg

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    20014x
                    
                      
		u <- -ug - s

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    
                    
                      
	} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    
                    
                      
	# Return results as a vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    183147x
                    
                      
	c(u, s, k)

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Phillips–Perron Unit Root Test

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Applies the Phillips–Perron (PP) test to check for a unit root in annual

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' maximum streamflow (AMS) data. The null hypothesis is that the series contains a 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' unit root (and is thus non-stationary). This implementation of the PP test assumes 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' the  time series has both stationary drift and a linear trend.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @param alpha Numeric (1); the significance level (default is 0.05).

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @param quiet Logical (1); if FALSE, prints a summary of results (default is TRUE).

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List; the test results, consisting of:

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `statistic`: The Z-statistic used to perform the test.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - `p.value`: Reported p-value from the test. See notes on interpolation thresholds.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reject`: Logical. TRUE if the null hypothesis of a unit root is rejected at `alpha`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - `msg`: Character string summarizing the test result (printed if `quiet = FALSE`).

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' The implementation of this test is based on the \pkg{aTSA} package, which interpolates 

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' p-values from a table of critical values presented in Fuller W. A. (1996). The 

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' critical values are only available for \eqn{\alpha \geq 0.01}. Therefore, a reported 

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'  p-value of 0.01 indicates \eqn{p \leq 0.01}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @references

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' Fuller, W. A. (1996). Introduction to statistical time series, second ed., Wiley, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' New York.

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{kpss.test}

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' pp.test(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats embed

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
pp.test <- function(data, alpha = 0.05, quiet = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
	# Construct time series yt and shifted time series yt1 for fitting the autoregressive model 

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    5x
                    
                      
	z <- embed(data ,2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    5x
                    
                      
    yt <- z[,1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    5x
                    
                      
    yt1 <- z[,2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
	# Set the number of Newey-West lags using the standard choice, proportional to n^(1/4)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    5x
                    
                      
    n <- length(yt)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    5x
                    
                      
    q <- floor(4 * (n / 100)^0.25)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
	# Create an autoregressive model with drift and trend (yt as a function of yt1 and t) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    5x
                    
                      
    t <- 1:n

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    5x
                    
                      
	model <- lm(yt ~ yt1 + t)

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the residuals, estimate for rho, and estimate for the SE of rho

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    5x
                    
                      
	residuals <- resid(model)

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    5x
                    
                      
	rho_hat <- summary(model)$coefficients[2,1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    5x
                    
                      
	se_rho_hat <- summary(model)$coefficients[2,2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the variance of the residuals (with n-3 degrees of freedom)

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    5x
                    
                      
	sigma_hat <- sum(residuals^2)/(n - 3) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
	# Calculate the sample autocovariances and store them in a vector gamma

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    5x
                    
                      
	gamma <- numeric(q + 1) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    5x
                    
                      
	for (i in 1:(q + 1)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    22x
                    
                      
		u <- embed(residuals, i)

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    22x
                    
                      
		gamma[i] = sum(u[,1] * u[,i]) / n

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute an estimator of the long-run variance 

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    5x
                    
                      
	lambda_hat <- gamma[1] + 2 * sum((1 - 1:q / (q + 1)) * gamma[-1])

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the test statistic z_rho

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    5x
                    
                      
	z_rho <- n * (rho_hat - 1) - (n^2 * se_rho_hat^2) / sigma_hat * (lambda_hat - gamma[1]) / 2

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
	# Define table of Rho statistics from Fuller W. A. (1996) for model with drift and trend

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    5x
                    
                      
    table_rho <- rbind(

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    5x
                    
                      
		c(-22.5, -20.0, -17.9, -15.6, -8.49, -3.65, -2.51, -1.53, -0.46),

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    5x
                    
                      
        c(-25.8, -22.4, -19.7, -16.8, -8.80, -3.71, -2.60, -1.67, -0.67),

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    5x
                    
                      
        c(-27.4, -23.7, -20.6, -17.5, -8.96, -3.74, -2.63, -1.74, -0.76),

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    5x
                    
                      
        c(-28.5, -24.4, -21.3, -17.9, -9.05, -3.76, -2.65, -1.79, -0.83),

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    5x
                    
                      
        c(-28.9, -24.7, -21.5, -18.1, -9.08, -3.76, -2.66, -1.80, -0.86),

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    5x
                    
                      
        c(-29.4, -25.0, -21.7, -18.3, -9.11, -3.77, -2.67, -1.81, -0.88)

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
	# Define the columns, sizes, and quantiles used in the table

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    5x
                    
                      
	columns <- ncol(table_rho)

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    5x
                    
                      
	sizes <- c(25, 50, 100, 250, 500, 1000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    5x
                    
                      
	quantiles <- c(.01, .025, .05, .10, .50, .90, .95, .975, .99)

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
	# Reduce table_rho to a 1D vector by interpolating on the sizes

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    5x
                    
                      
	interpolated_size <- numeric(columns)

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    5x
                    
                      
	for (j in 1:columns) { 

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    45x
                    
                      
		interpolated_size[j] <- approx(sizes, table_rho[,j], n, rule = 2)$y

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
	# Interpolate the p-value from the 1D vector of rho statistics

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    5x
                    
                      
	p_value <- approx(interpolated_size, quantiles, z_rho, rule = 2)$y

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine whether we reject or fail to reject based on p_value and alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    5x
                    
                      
	reject <- if (alpha == 0.10) p_value < alpha else p_value <= alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      
	# Set the P-value text to inform the user of the limited significance thresholds

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    5x
                    
                      
	p_text <- if (p_value == 0.10) { 

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    !
                    
                      
		"*at least* 0.10" 

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    5x
                    
                      
	} else if (p_value == 0.01) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    5x
                    
                      
		"*at most* 0.01"

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      
	} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    !
                    
                      
		round(p_value, 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      
	# Print the results of the test

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    5x
                    
                      
	msg <- test_message(

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    5x
                    
                      
		"Phillips-Perron",

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    5x
                    
                      
		reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    5x
                    
                      
		p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    5x
                    
                      
		alpha,

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    5x
                    
                      
		"evidence of a unit root.",

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    5x
                    
                      
		"NO evidence of a unit root."

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    
                    
                      
	

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    5x
                    
                      
	if (!quiet) message(msg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the results as a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    5x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    5x
                    
                      
		statistic = z_rho,

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    5x
                    
                      
		p.value = p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    5x
                    
                      
		reject = reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    5x
                    
                      
		msg = msg

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' L-Moments Parameter Estimation for the Kappa Distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' This functions estimates the parameters of the four-parameter Kappa distribution using 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' the method of L-moments. Since there is no known closed form solution for the parameters 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' in terms of the L-moments, the parameters are computed numerically using Newton-Raphson

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' iteration.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @details 

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' First, the sample L-moments of the data are computed using the \link{lmom.sample}

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' method. Then, the \link[stats]{optim} function is used to determine the

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' parameters by minimizing the `sumquad.tau3tau4` helper function. The implementation of

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' this routine is based on the deprecated `homtest` package.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Numeric (4); a vector of parameters.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @references

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' Hosking, J.R.M. & Wallis, J.R., 1997. Regional frequency analysis: an approach based 

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' on L-Moments. Cambridge University Press, New York, USA.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' pelkap(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
pelkap <- function(data) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the sample L-moments

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    15x
                    
                      
	moments <- lmom.sample(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    15x
                    
                      
	l1 <- moments[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    15x
                    
                      
	l2 <- moments[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    15x
                    
                      
	t3 <- moments[3]

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    15x
                    
                      
	t4 <- moments[4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
	# We want to minimize this function

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    15x
                    
                      
    sumquad.tau3tau4 = function (k.h, t3.t4) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    1085x
                    
                      
		k <- k.h[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    1085x
                    
                      
		h <- k.h[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    1085x
                    
                      
		t3 <- t3.t4[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    1085x
                    
                      
		t4 <- t3.t4[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    1085x
                    
                      
		if (((k < -1) && (h >= 0)) || ((h < 0) && ((k <= -1) || (k >= -1/h)))) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    !
                    
                      
			stop("Invalid parameters.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    1085x
                    
                      
		g <- c(0,0,0,0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
		# GEV Case

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    1085x
                    
                      
		if (h == 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    !
                    
                      
			tau3 <- 2*(1 - 3^(-k))/(1 - 2^(-k)) - 3

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    !
                    
                      
			tau4 <- (5*(1 - 4^(-k)) - 10*(1 - 3^(-k)) + 6*(1 - 2^(-k)))/(1 - 2^(-k))

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
		# General Kappa Distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
		else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    1085x
                    
                      
			for (r in 1:4) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    4340x
                    
                      
				if (h > 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    3540x
                    
                      
					g[r] <- (r*gamma(1+k)*gamma(r/h)) / (h^(1+k) *gamma(1+k+r/h))

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
				}

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
				else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    800x
                    
                      
					g[r]=(r*gamma(1+k)*gamma(-k-r/h)) / ((-h)^(1+k) *gamma(1-r/h))

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
				}

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
		  	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    1085x
                    
                      
		    tau3 <- (-g[1] + 3*g[2] -2*g[3])/(g[1]-g[2])

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    1085x
                    
                      
		    tau4 <- -(-g[1] + 6*g[2] -10*g[3] + 5*g[4])/(g[1]-g[2])

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    1085x
                    
                      
		(t3-tau3)^2 + (t4-tau4)^2

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    15x
                    
                      
    mu.sigma = function (l1, l2, k, h) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    15x
                    
                      
		if (((k < -1) && (h >= 0)) || ((h < 0) && ((k <= -1) || (k >= -1/h)))) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    !
                    
                      
			stop("Invalid parameters.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    15x
                    
                      
		g <- c(0,0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
		# GEV Case

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    15x
                    
                      
		if (h == 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    !
                    
                      
		    sigma <- (l2*k)/((1 - 2^(-k))*gamma(1+k))

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    !
                    
                      
		    mu <- l1 - sigma*(1 - gamma(1+k))/k

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
		# General Kappa Distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
		else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    15x
                    
                      
			for (r in 1:2) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    30x
                    
                      
				if (h > 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    22x
                    
                      
					g[r] <- (r*gamma(1+k)*gamma(r/h)) / (h^(1+k) *gamma(1+k+r/h))

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
			  	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      
			  	else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    8x
                    
                      
					g[r]=(r*gamma(1+k)*gamma(-k-r/h)) / ((-h)^(1+k) *gamma(1-r/h))

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
			  	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
			}

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    15x
                    
                      
  		    sigma <- (l2*k)/(g[1]-g[2])

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    15x
