  		    mu <- l1 - sigma*(1-g[1])/k

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    15x
                    
                      
    	list(mu = mu, sigma = sigma)

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    15x
                    
                      
    result <- optim(c(1,1), sumquad.tau3tau4, t3.t4 = c(t3, t4))

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    15x
                    
                      
    if (result$value != -1) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    15x
                    
                      
        k <- result$par[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    15x
                    
                      
        h <- result$par[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    15x
                    
                      
        params <- mu.sigma(l1, l2, k, h)

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    15x
                    
                      
        mu <- params$mu

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    15x
                    
                      
        sigma <- params$sigma

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    15x
                    
                      
	c(mu, sigma, k, h)

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Maximum Likelihood Parameter Estimation

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Estimates parameters of a probability distribution (`GUM`, `NOR`, `LNO`, `GEV`, `GLO`, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' `GNO`, `PE3`, `LP3`, or `WEI`) or non-stationary variant by maximizing the log‐likelihood.

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' Initial values are obtained through L‐moment parameter estimation, and optimization is

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' performed via \link[stats]{nlminb} with repeated perturbations if needed.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @param years Numeric; a vector of years with the same length as `data`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @param model Character (1); string specifying the probability model. The first three 

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'   letters denote the family: `GUM`, `NOR`, `LNO`, `GEV`, `GLO`, `GNO`, `PE3`, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'   `LP3`, or `WEI`. A trailing signature of `10` or `100` indicates a linear trend 

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'   in location; `11` or `110` indicates linear trends in both location and scale.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @param prior Numeric (2); optional vector of parameters \eqn{(p, q)} that specifies 

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'  the parameters of a Beta prior on \eqn{\kappa}. Only works with models `GEV`, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'  `GEV100`, and `GEV110`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List; results of parameter estimation:

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' - `params`: Numeric vector of estimated parameters.

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' - `mll`: Maximum log‐likelihood value.

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' 1. Calls \link{pelxxx} on `data` to obtain initial parameter estimates.

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' 2. Initializes trend parameters to zero if there is a trailing signature.  

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' 3. For `WEI` models, sets the location parameter to zero to ensure support.  

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' 4. Defines an objective function as the negative of the \link{llvxxx} function.  

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' 5. Runs \link[stats]{nlminb} with box constraints. Attempts optimization

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#'    up to 100 times.  

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @note Although the more modern \link[stats]{optim} function is preferred over 

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' \link[stats]{nlminb}, we use \link[stats]{nlminb} because it supports non-finite

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' values of the likelihood function. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{llvxxx}, \link{gllxxx}, \link{pelxxx}, \link[stats]{nlminb}

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' mle.estimation(data, years, "GNO100")

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats optim rnorm

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
mle.estimation <- function(data, years, model, prior = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the name and signature for the model 

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    13085x
                    
                      
	name <- substr(model, 1, 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    13085x
                    
                      
	signature <- if(nchar(model) == 3) NULL else substr(model, 4, 5)

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
	

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine the initial parameters using L-moments estimation

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    13085x
                    
                      
	p <- pelxxx(name, data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
	# Initialize the non-stationary parameters to 0 (if necessary)

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    13085x
                    
                      
	if (is.null(signature)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    7037x
                    
                      
		covariate <- NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    7037x
                    
                      
		initial_params <- c(p[1], p[2])

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    7037x
                    
                      
		lower <- c(-Inf, 1e-8)

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    7037x
                    
                      
		upper <- c( Inf,  Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    13085x
                    
                      
	} else if (signature == "10") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    6027x
                    
                      
		covariate <- get.covariates(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    6027x
                    
                      
		initial_params <- c(p[1], 0, p[2])	

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    6027x
                    
                      
		lower <- c(-Inf, -Inf, 1e-8)

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    6027x
                    
                      
		upper <- c( Inf,  Inf,  Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    13085x
                    
                      
	} else if  (signature == "11") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    21x
                    
                      
		covariate <- get.covariates(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    21x
                    
                      
		initial_params <- c(p[1], 0, p[2], 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    21x
                    
                      
		lower <- c(-Inf, -Inf, 1e-8, -Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    21x
                    
                      
		upper <- c( Inf,  Inf,  Inf,  Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
	} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
	# Add the kappa parameter (if necessary)

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    13085x
                    
                      
	if (name %in% c("GEV", "GLO", "GNO", "PE3", "LP3", "WEI")) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    10066x
                    
                      
		initial_params <- c(initial_params, p[3])

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
		# Shape parameter must between -0.5 and 0.5 if we are doing GMLE 

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    10066x
                    
                      
		if (!is.null(prior)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    2021x
                    
                      
			lower <- c(lower, -0.5 + 1e-8)

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    2021x
                    
                      
			upper <- c(upper,  0.5 - 1e-8)

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
		} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    8045x
                    
                      
			lower <- c(lower, -Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    8045x
                    
                      
			upper <- c(upper,  Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
		} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
	# NOTE: The parameters for the Weibull distribution produced by lmom.estimation

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
	# often do not have support for smaller data points. Therefore, we need to start

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
	# the MLE optimization process with mu = 0 to guarantee the data has support.	

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    13085x
                    
                      
	if (name == "WEI") initial_params[1] <- 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
	# Maximize the log-likelihood by minimizing the negative log-likelihood

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    13085x
                    
                      
	objective <- function(theta) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    2053234x
                    
                      
		if (!is.null(prior)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    607208x
                    
                      
			0 - gllxxx(name, signature, data, theta, prior, covariate)

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
		} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    1446026x
                    
                      
			0 - llvxxx(name, signature, data, theta, covariate) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
	} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      
	# Helper function for running parameter optimization

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    13085x
                    
                      
	optimizer <- function(params) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    13241x
                    
                      
		nlminb(params, objective, lower = lower, upper = upper)

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      
	# Repeatedly attempt optimization using the nlminb() function

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    13085x
                    
                      
	attempts <- 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    13085x
                    
                      
	current_params <- initial_params

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    13085x
                    
                      
	while (attempts <= 100) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      
		# Attempt to run the optimize() function

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    13241x
                    
                      
		result <- optimizer(current_params)

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    
                    
                      
		# If optimization succeeded, end the loop

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    13241x
                    
                      
		if (result$objective != Inf) break

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      
		# If optimization failed, perturb the parameters and try again

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    156x
                    
                      
		perturbation <- rnorm(n = length(initial_params), mean = 0, sd = 0.2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    156x
                    
                      
		current_params <- initial_params * (1 + perturbation)

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    156x
                    
                      
		attempts <- attempts + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the optimal parameters if fitting succeeded, otherwise return NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    13085x
                    
                      
	list(params = result$par, mll = -result$objective)

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Plot Return Levels and Confidence Intervals

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Constructs a time–series plot of estimated return levels along with their 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' associated confidence intervals. The confidence bounds are shown as a shaded ribbon,

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' and the point estimates are overlaid as a solid line. The return periods are 

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' displayed on a logarithmic scale.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' If the specified model is non-stationary, the `slice` argument is required

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' and the return levels are reported as "Effective Return Periods". 

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @param model Character (1); string specifying the probability model. The first three 

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'   letters denote the family: `GUM`, `NOR`, `LNO`, `GEV`, `GLO`, `GNO`, `PE3`, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'   `LP3`, or `WEI`. A trailing signature of `10` or `100` indicates a linear trend 

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'   in location; `11` or `110` indicates linear trends in both location and scale.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @param results List; generated by \link{sb.uncertainty} or \link{rfpl.uncertainty}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @param slice Character (1); the anchor year for non-stationary return level estimates.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'   Required for models ending in `10`, `100`, `11`, or `110`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @return `ggplot`; a plot showing:

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' - A dashed black line for both the lower and upper confidence bounds.

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' - A semi-transparent gray ribbon between `results$ci_lower` and `results$ci_upper`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' - A solid blue line for the point estimates.

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' results <- sb.uncertainty(data, years, "WEI", "L-moments")

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' uncertainty.plot("WEI", results)

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' @import ggplot2

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
uncertainty.plot <- function(model, results, slice = 1) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the name and signature for the model 

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    2x
                    
                      
	name <- substr(model, 1, 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    2x
                    
                      
	signature <- if (nchar(model) == 3) NULL else substr(model, 4, 5)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
	# Create a dataframe for the results

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    2x
                    
                      
	df <- data.frame(

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    2x
                    
                      
		t = results[[slice]]$t,

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    2x
                    
                      
		ci_lower = results[[slice]]$ci_lower,

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    2x
                    
                      
		ci_upper = results[[slice]]$ci_upper,

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    2x
                    
                      
		estimates = results[[slice]]$estimates

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
	# Define labels for the plot 

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    2x
                    
                      
	x_label <- if (is.null(signature)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    1x
                    
                      
		"Return Period (Years)" 

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
	} else { 

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    1x
                    
                      
		sprintf("Effective Return Period in %s", slice)

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    2x
                    
                      
	y_label <- expression("AMS (" * m^3/s * ")")

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
	# Define properties for the legend

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    2x
                    
                      
	labels <- c("Confidence Bounds", "Estimates")

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    2x
                    
                      
	styles <- c("dashed", "solid")

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
	# Generate the plot, adding the theme without plot-theme.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    2x
                    
                      
	p1 <- ggplot(data = df, aes(x = t)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    2x
                    
                      
		geom_line(

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    2x
                    
                      
			aes(y = .data$ci_lower, linetype = "1"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    2x
                    
                      
			color = "black",

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    2x
                    
                      
			linewidth = 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
		) + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    2x
                    
                      
		geom_line(

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    2x
                    
                      
			aes(y = .data$ci_upper, linetype = "1"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    2x
                    
                      
			color = "black",

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    2x
                    
                      
			linewidth = 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
		) + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    2x
                    
                      
		geom_ribbon(

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    2x
                    
                      
			aes(ymin = .data$ci_lower, ymax = .data$ci_upper),

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    2x
                    
                      
			fill = "gray",

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    2x
                    
                      
			alpha = 0.4

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
		) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    2x
                    
                      
		geom_line(

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    2x
                    
                      
			aes(y = .data$estimates, linetype = "2"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    2x
                    
                      
			color = "blue",

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    2x
                    
                      
			linewidth = 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
		) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    2x
                    
                      
		scale_linetype_manual(labels = labels, values = styles) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    2x
                    
                      
		labs(

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    2x
                    
                      
			x = x_label,

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    2x
                    
                      
			y = y_label,

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    2x
                    
                      
			linetype = "Legend",

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    2x
                    
                      
			title = "FFA Estimates and Uncertainty"

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      
		) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    2x
                    
                      
		scale_x_log10(breaks = df$t)

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
	# Add the theme and return 

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    2x
                    
                      
	add_theme(p1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Log-Likelihood Functions for Probability Models

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Compute the log-likelihood value for stationary and non-stationary variants 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' of nine different distributions (`GUM`, `NOR`, `LNO`, `GEV`, `GLO`, `GNO`, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' `PE3`, `LP3`, and `WEI`).

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @details 

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' The log-likelihood is the logarithm of the probability density function.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' For two-parameter distributions (`GUM`, `NOR`, `LNO`), there are three 

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' different `llv` functions:

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' - `llv...()`: Stationary location and scale, 2 parameters.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' - `llv...10()`: Time-varying location, stationary scale, 3 parameters.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - `llv...11()`: Time-varying location and scale, 4 parameters.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' For three-parameter distributions (`GEV`, `GLO`, `GNO`, `PE3`, `LP3`, `WEI`), 

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' there are also three different `llv` functions:

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' - `llv...()`: Stationary location and scale, 3 parameters.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' - `llv...100()`: Time-varying location, stationary scale, 4 parameters.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' - `llv...110()`: Time-varying location and scale, 5 parameters.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @note

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' The `llv...` functions perform extensive parameter validation, which can be slow. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' If you plan to make calls these methods often, it is recommended to use the \link{llvxxx} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' helper function instead.

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' @param params Numeric; a vector of parameters. Must have the correct length for the model.

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @param years Numeric; a vector of years with the same length as `data`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'   Required for non-stationary models, which end in `10`, `11`, `100`, or `110`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Numeric (1); the log-likelihood value.

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{llvxxx}

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' # Initialize data, years, and params

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' params <- c(0, 1, 1, 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' # Compute the log-likelihood

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' llvgno100(data, params, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' @name llv-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
llvvalidate <- function(n, data, params, years = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
	# Validate the data vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    75x
                    
                      
	if (!is.numeric(data) | !is.vector(data)) stop("'data' must be a numeric vector.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    69x
                    
                      
	if (any(is.nan(data)) | any(is.na(data))) stop("'data' must not contain NaN/NA values.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    63x
                    
                      
	if (any(data <= 0)) stop("'data' must not contain negative values.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
	# Validate the parameter vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    57x
                    
                      
	if (!is.numeric(params) | !is.vector(params)) stop("'params' must be a numeric vector.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    51x
                    
                      
	if (any(is.nan(params)) | any(is.na(params))) stop("'params' must not contain NaN/NA values.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    45x
                    
                      
	if (length(params) != n) stop(sprintf("'params' must have length %d.", n))

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
	# Validate the years vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    39x
                    
                      
	if (!is.null(years)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    39x
                    
                      
		if (!is.numeric(years) | !is.vector(years)) stop("'years' must be a numeric vector.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    35x
                    
                      
		if (any(is.nan(years)) | any(is.na(years))) stop("'years' must not contain NaN/NA values.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    31x
                    
                      
		if (length(years) != length(data)) stop("'years' must have the same length as 'data'.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname llv-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
llvgum    <- function(data, params, years = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    7x
                    
                      
	llvvalidate(2, data, params, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    1x
                    
                      
	llvxxx("GUM", NULL, data, params, NULL)

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname llv-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
llvgum10  <- function(data, params, years) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    10x
                    
                      
	llvvalidate(3, data, params, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    1x
                    
                      
	covariate <- get.covariates(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    1x
                    
                      
	llvxxx("GUM", "10", data, params, covariate)

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname llv-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    89

                    10x

                    91
                    1x
                    
                      
	covariate <- get.covariates(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    1x
                    
                      
	llvxxx("GUM", "11", data, params, covariate)

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    94

llvwei    <- function(data, params, years = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    267
                    1x
                    
                      
	llvvalidate(3, data, params, years)

                    1x
                    
                      
	llvxxx("WEI", NULL, data, params, NULL)

llvwei100 <- function(data, params, years) {

                    1x
                    
                      
	llvvalidate(4, data, params, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    275
                    1x

                    1x
