                    281
                    
                    
                      
llvwei110 <- function(data, params, years) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    282
                    1x
                    
                      
	llvvalidate(5, data, params, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    283
                    1x
                    
                      
	covariate <- get.covariates(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    284
                    1x
                    
                      
	llvxxx("WEI", "11", data, params, covariate)

                    		
                  

                  

                    285
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Quantile Functions for Probability Models

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Compute the quantiles for stationary and non-stationary variants 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' of nine different distributions (`GUM`, `NOR`, `LNO`, `GEV`, `GLO`, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' `GNO`, `PE3`, `LP3`, and `WEI`).

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @details 

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' The quantile function is the inverse of the cumulative distribution function.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' For the two-parameter distributions (`GUM`, `NOR`, `LNO`), there are three 

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' different `qnt` functions:

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' - `qnt...()`: Stationary location and scale, 2 parameters.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' - `qnt...10()`: Time-varying location, stationary scale, 3 parameters.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - `qnt...11()`: Time-varying location and scale, 4 parameters.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' For three-parameter distributions (`GEV`, `GLO`, `GNO`, `PE3`, `LP3`, `WEI`), 

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' there are also three `qnt` functions:

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' - `qnt...()`: Stationary location and scale, 3 parameters.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' - `qnt...100()`: Time-varying location, stationary scale, 4 parameters.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' - `qnt...110()`: Time-varying location and scale, 5 parameters.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @note

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' The `qnt...`, functions perform extensive parameter validation, which can be slow. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' If you plan to make many calls to these methods, it is recommended to use 

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' the \link{qntxxx} helper function instead.

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @param p Numeric; a vector of probabilities between 0 and 1.

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' @param params Numeric; a vector of parameters. Must have the correct length for the model.

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @param years Numeric; a vector of years with the same length as `data`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'   Required for non-stationary models, which end in `10`, `11`, `100`, or `110`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' @return If `p` or `years` is a scalar, returns a numeric vector. Otherwise, returns a matrix.

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{qntxxx}

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' # Initialize p, years, and params

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' p <- runif(n = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' params <- c(0, 1, 1, 1, 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' # Compute the quantiles

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' qntwei110(p, params, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' @name qnt-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
qntvalidate <- function(n, p, params, years = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
	# Validate the data vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    200043x
                    
                      
	if (!is.numeric(p) | !is.vector(p)) stop("'p' must be a numeric vector.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    200043x
                    
                      
	if (any(is.nan(p)) | any(is.na(p))) stop("'p' must not contain NaN/NA values.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    200043x
                    
                      
	if (any(p < 0) | any(p > 1)) stop("'p' must be between 0 and 1 inclusive.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
	# Validate the parameter vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    200041x
                    
                      
	if (!is.numeric(params) | !is.vector(params)) stop("'params' must be a numeric vector.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    200040x
                    
                      
	if (any(is.nan(params)) | any(is.na(params))) stop("'params' must not contain NaN/NA values.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    200039x
                    
                      
	if (length(params) != n) stop(sprintf("'params' must have length %d.", n))

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
	# Validate the years vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    200038x
                    
                      
	if (!is.null(years)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    5x
                    
                      
		if (!is.numeric(years) | !is.vector(years)) stop("'years' must be a numeric vector.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    5x
                    
                      
		if (any(is.nan(years)) | any(is.na(years))) stop("'years' must not contain NaN/NA values.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname qnt-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
qntgum    <- function(p, params, years = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    7x
                    
                      
	qntvalidate(2, p, params, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    2x
                    
                      
	qntxxx("GUM", NULL, p, params)

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname qnt-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
qntgum10  <- function(p, params, years) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    2x
                    
                      
	qntvalidate(3, p, params, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    !
                    
                      
	covariates <- get.covariates(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    !
                    
                      
	qntxxx("GUM", "10", p, params, covariates)

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname qnt-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
qntgum11  <- function(p, params, years) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    !
                    
                      
	qntvalidate(4, p, params, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    !
                    
                      
	covariates <- get.covariates(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    !
                    
                      
	qntxxx("GUM", "11", p, params, covariates)

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname qnt-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    97

qntwei110 <- function(p, params, years) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    281
                    !

                    289
                    
                    
                      
qntkap    <- function(p, params, years = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    290
                    2e+05x
                    
                      
	qntvalidate(4, p, params, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    291
                    2e+05x
                    
                      
	qntxxx("KAP", NULL, p, params)

                    		
                  

                  

                    292
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    293
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Regula-Falsi Confidence Intervals for Flood Quantile Estimates

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Calculates estimates and confidence intervals for return levels at standard 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' return periods (2, 5, 10, 20, 50, and 100 years) using the profile likelihood 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' and Regula-Falsi root‐finding method.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @param years Numeric; a vector of years with the same length as `data`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @param model Character (1); string specifying the probability model. The first three 

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'   letters denote the family: `GUM`, `NOR`, `LNO`, `GEV`, `GLO`, `GNO`, `PE3`, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'   `LP3`, or `WEI`. A trailing signature of `10` or `100` indicates a linear trend 

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'   in location; `11` or `110` indicates linear trends in both location and scale.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @param slices Character (1) or Numeric; specifies the years at which

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'   to compute the estimates and confidence intervals (default is "last").

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'   - `"all"`: returns estimates for all values in `years`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'   - `"first"`: returns estimates for first year in the dataset.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'   - `"last"`: returns estimates for last year in the dataset.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Passing a numeric vector to `slices` allows for custom values.

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'   If the chosen model is stationary, the results will be the same for all slices.

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @param alpha Numeric (1); the significance level (default is 0.05).

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @param eps Numeric (1); tolerance for the Regula-Falsi convergence (default is 0.01).

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' @param prior Numeric (2); optional vector of parameters \eqn{(p, q)} that specifies 

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'  the parameters of a Beta prior on \eqn{\kappa}. Only works with models `GEV`, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#'  `GEV100`, and `GEV110`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List; quantiles and confidence intervals. Each year maps to a sub-list:

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' - `estimates`: Estimated quantiles for each return period.

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' - `ci_lower`: Lower bound of the confidence interval for each return period.

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' - `ci_upper`: Upper bound of the confidence interval for each return period.

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' - `t`: Vector of return periods; `c(2, 5, 10, 20, 50, 100)`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' 1. Fits the model using \link{mle.estimation} to obtain parameter estimates and log‐likelihood.  

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' 2. Defines an objective function \eqn{f(y_p, p)} based on the chi-squared distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' 3. Iteratively brackets the root by scaling initial guesses by 0.05 until f changes sign.  

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#' 4. Uses the Regula Falsi method to solve \eqn{f(y_p, p) = 0} for each return-period probability.  

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' 5. Returns lower and upper confidence bounds at level alpha and the quantile estimates.

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' @note Although the more modern \link[stats]{optim} function is preferred over 

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' \link[stats]{nlminb}, we use \link[stats]{nlminb} because it supports non-finite

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#' values of the likelihood function. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{qntxxx}, \link{sb.uncertainty}, \link[stats]{nlminb}

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#' rfpl.uncertainty(data, years, "GLO110")

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats qchisq

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
rfpl.uncertainty <- function(

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
  data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
  years,

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
  model,

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
  slices = "last",

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
  alpha = 0.05,

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
  eps = 1e-2,

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
  prior = NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the name, signature, and covariates

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    24x
                    
                      
	name <- substr(model, 1, 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    24x
                    
                      
	signature <- if(nchar(model) == 3) NULL else substr(model, 4, 5)

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    24x
                    
                      
	year_covariates <- get.covariates(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
	# Helper function for reparameterizing Weibull distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
	# Helper function for computing the profile likelihood

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    24x
                    
                      
	profile.likelihood <- function(yp, p, params, slice, prior = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
		# Remove the parameter we are using for reparameterization on yp

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    3958x
                    
                      
		if (name != "WEI") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    3489x
                    
                      
			params <- params[-1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    3958x
                    
                      
		} else if (name == "WEI" && is.null(signature)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    142x
                    
                      
			params <- params[-2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
		} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    327x
                    
                      
			params <- params[-3]

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      
		} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
		# Set the default bounds based on the signature and distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    3958x
                    
                      
		if (is.null(signature)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    1595x
                    
                      
			lower <- c(1e-8)

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    1595x
                    
                      
			upper <- c( Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    3958x
                    
                      
		} else if (signature == "10") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    1188x
                    
                      
			lower <- c(-Inf, 1e-8)

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    1188x
                    
                      
			upper <- c( Inf,  Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    3958x
                    
                      
		} else if  (signature == "11") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    1175x
                    
                      
			lower <- c(-Inf, 1e-8, -Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    1175x
                    
                      
			upper <- c( Inf,  Inf,  Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
		} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      
		# The Weibull distribution has different parameter bounds

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    3958x
                    
                      
		if (model == "WEI") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    142x
                    
                      
			lower <- c(-Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    142x
                    
                      
			upper <- c( Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    3958x
                    
                      
		} else if (model == "WEI100") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    169x
                    
                      
			lower <- c(-Inf, -Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    169x
                    
                      
			upper <- c( Inf,  Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    3958x
                    
                      
		} else if  (model == "WEI110") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    158x
                    
                      
			lower <- c(-Inf, -Inf, -Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    158x
                    
                      
			upper <- c( Inf,  Inf,  Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      
		# Add the kappa parameter if we have a 3-parameter distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    3958x
                    
                      
		if (name %in% c("GEV", "GLO", "GNO", "PE3", "LP3", "WEI")) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    2759x
                    
                      
			lower <- c(lower, -Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    2759x
                    
                      
			upper <- c(upper,  Inf)

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      
		# Override the bounds on Kappa if we are doing generalized RFPL

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    3958x
                    
                      
		if (name == "GEV" && !is.null(prior)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    829x
                    
                      
			lower[length(lower)] <- -0.5 + 1e-8

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    829x
                    
                      
			upper[length(upper)] <-  0.5 - 1e-8

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    
                    
                      
		} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    
                    
                      
		# Maximize the log-likelihood by minimizing the negative log-likelihood

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    3958x
                    
                      
		objective <- function(theta) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    
                    
                      
			# Use the standard reparameterization for non-Weibull distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    501342x
                    
                      
			if (name != "WEI") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    
                    
                      
				# Get the quantile at probability p with location 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    423139x
                    
                      
				qp <- qntxxx(name, signature, p, c(0, theta), slice)

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    
                    
                      
				# Log-transform yp, qp if necessary

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    421773x
                    
                      
				name <- substr(model, 1, 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    421773x
                    
                      
				if (name %in% c("LNO", "LP3")) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    8263x
                    
                      
					yp <- log(yp)

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    8263x
                    
                      
					qp <- log(qp)

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    
                    
                      
				}

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    
                    
                      
				# Reparameterize in terms of the quantiles

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    421773x
                    
                      
				theta <- c(yp - qp, theta)

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    
                    
                      
			}

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    
                    
                      
			# Use a different reparameterization for the Weibull distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    499976x
                    
                      
			if (model == "WEI") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    7635x
                    
                      
				qp <- qntxxx(name, NULL, p, c(0, 1, theta[2]))

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    7635x
                    
                      
				sigma <- ((yp - theta[1]) / qp) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    7635x
                    
                      
				theta <- c(theta[1], sigma, theta[2])

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    499976x
                    
                      
			} else if (model == "WEI100") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    24916x
                    
                      
				qp <- qntxxx(name, NULL, p, c(0, 1, theta[3]))

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    24916x
                    
                      
				sigma <- ((yp - theta[1] - (theta[2] * slice)) / qp) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    24916x
                    
                      
				theta <- c(theta[1:2], sigma, theta[3])

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    499976x
                    
                      
			} else if (model == "WEI110") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    45652x
                    
                      
				qp <- qntxxx(name, NULL, p, c(0, 1, theta[4]))

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    45652x
                    
                      
				sigma <- ((yp - theta[1] - (theta[2] * slice)) / qp) - (theta[3] * slice)

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    45652x
                    
                      
				theta <- c(theta[1:2], sigma, theta[3:4])

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    
                    
                      
			}

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    
                    
                      
			# Use the correct likelihood function based on whether there is a prior

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    499976x
                    
                      
			if (!is.null(prior)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    131097x
                    
                      
				0 - gllxxx(name, signature, data, theta, prior, year_covariates)

                    		
                  

                  

                    164
                    
                    
                      
			} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    165
                    368879x
                    
                      
				0 - llvxxx(name, signature, data, theta, year_covariates)

                    		
                  

                  

                    166
                    
                    
                      
			}

                    		
                  

                  

                    167
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    168
                    
                    
                      
		} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    169
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    170
                    
                    
                      
		# Helper function for running parameter optimization

                    		
                  

                  

                    171
                    3958x
                    
                      
		optimizer <- function(theta) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    172
                    5324x
                    
                      
			nlminb(theta, objective, lower = lower, upper = upper)

                    		
                  

                  

                    173
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    174
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    175
                    
                    
                      
		# Repeatedly attempt optimization using the optim() function

                    		
                  

                  

                    176
                    3958x
                    
                      
		attempts <- 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    177
                    3958x
                    
                      
		current_params <- params

                    		
                  

                  

                    178
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    179
                    3958x
                    
                      
		while (attempts <= 100) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    180
                    
                    
                      
			

                    		
                  

                  

                    181
                    
                    
                      
			# Attempt to run the optimize() function

                    		
                  

                  

                    182
                    5324x
                    
                      
			result <- tryCatch(

                    		
                  

                  

                    183
                    5324x
                    
                      
				{ optimizer(current_params) },

                    		
                  

                  

                    184
                    1366x
                    
                      
				error = function(e) { NULL }

                    		
                  

                  

                    185
                    
                    
                      
			)

                    		
                  

                  

                    186
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    187
                    
                    
                      
			# If optimization succeeded, end the loop

                    		
                  

                  

                    188
                    5324x
                    
                      
			if (!is.null(result)) break

                    		
                  

                  

                    189
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    190
                    
                    
                      
			# If optimization failed, perturb the parameters and try again

                    		
                  

                  

                    191
                    1366x
                    
                      
			perturbation <- rnorm(n = length(params), mean = 0, sd = 0.2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    192
                    1366x
                    
                      
			current_params <- params * (1 + perturbation)

                    		
                  

                  

                    193
                    1366x
                    
                      
			attempts <- attempts + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    194
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    195
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    196
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    197
                    
                    
                      
		# Flip the sign because we optimized the negative log-likelihood earlier

                    		
                  

                  

                    198
                    3958x
                    
                      
		0 - result$objective

                    		
                  

                  

                    199
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    200
                    
                    
                      
	} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    201
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    202
                    
                    
                      
	# Define the non-exceedance probabilities for the target return periods

                    		
                  

                  

                    203
                    24x
                    
                      
	t <- c(2, 5, 10, 20, 50, 100)

                    		
                  

                  

                    204
                    24x
                    
                      
	returns <- 1 - (1 / t)

                    		
                  

                  

                    205
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    206
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine the slices based on the "slices" argument

                    		
                  

                  

                    207
                    24x
                    
                      
	if (is.character(slices)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    208
                    24x
                    
                      
		slices <- switch(

                    		
                  

                  

                    209
                    24x
                    
                      
			slices,

                    		
                  

                  

                    210
                    24x
                    
                      
			"all" = years,

                    		
                  

                  

                    211
                    24x
                    
                      
			"first" = min(years),

                    		
                  

                  

                    212
                    24x
                    
                      
			"last" = max(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    213
                    
                    
                      
		)

                    		
                  

                  

                    214
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    215
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    216
                    24x
                    
                      
	slice_covariates <- get.covariates(slices)

                    		
                  

                  

                    217
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    218
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the results of maximum likelihood estimation

                    		
                  

                  

                    219
                    24x
                    
                      
	mle <- if (is.null(prior)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    220
                    19x
                    
                      
		mle.estimation(data, years, model) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    221
                    
                    
                      
	} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    222
                    5x
                    
                      
		mle.estimation(data, years, model, prior) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    223
                    
                    
                      
	} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    224
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    225
                    24x
                    
                      
	lp_hat <- mle$mll

                    		
                  

                  

                    226
                    24x
                    
                      
	yp_hat <- qntxxx(name, signature, returns, mle$params, slice_covariates)

                    		
                  

                  

                    227
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    228
                    
                    
                      
	# We want to find the roots of the function f defined below:

                    		
                  

                  

                    229
                    24x
                    
                      
	f <- function(yp, p, slice) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    230
                    3958x
                    
                      
		lp_theta <- profile.likelihood(yp, p, mle$params, slice, prior)

                    		
                  

                  

                    231
                    3958x
                    
                      
		lp_theta - (lp_hat - (qchisq(1 - alpha, 1) /2))

                    		
                  

                  

                    232
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    233
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    234
                    
                    
                      
	# Define a helper function for regula-falsi iteration

                    		
                  

                  

                    235
                    24x
                    
                      
	regula.falsi <- function(a, b, p, slice) { 

                    		
                  

                  

                    236
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    237
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute c from a and b

                    		
                  

                  

                    238
                    993x
                    
                      
		fa <- f(a, p, slice)

                    		
                  

                  

                    239
                    993x
                    
                      
		fb <- f(b, p, slice)

                    		
                  

                  

                    240
                    993x
                    
                      
		c <- ((a * fb) - (b * fa)) / (fb - fa)

                    		
                  

                  

                    241
                    
                    
                      
		

                    		
                  

                  

                    242
                    
                    
                      
		# If f(c) is small, we are done

                    		
                  

                  

                    243
                    993x
                    
                      
		fc <- f(c, p, slice)

                    		
                  

                  

                    244
                    993x
                    
                      
		if (abs(fc) < eps) return (c) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    245
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    246
                    
                    
                      
		# Otherwise, update a, b and then call regula.falsi again

                    		
                  

                  

                    247
                    562x
                    
                      
		if (fc < 0) { a <- c } else { b <- c }

                    		
                  

                  

                    248
                    705x
                    
                      
		regula.falsi(a, b, p, slice)

                    		
                  

                  

                    249
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    250
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    251
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    252
                    
                    
                      
	# Define a helper function for uncertainty quantification

                    		
                  

                  

                    253
                    24x
                    
                      
	compute.uncertainty <- function(yp_hat, slice) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    254
                    
                    
                      
	 

                    		
                  

                  

                    255
                    24x
                    
                      
		ci_lower <- numeric(length(yp_hat))

                    		
                  

                  

                    256
                    24x
                    
                      
		ci_upper <- numeric(length(yp_hat))

                    		
                  

                  

                    257
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    258
                    
                    
                      
		# Iterate through the return periods 

                    		
                  

                  

                    259
                    24x
                    
                      
		for (i in 1:length(yp_hat)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    260
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    261
                    
                    
                      
			# Find initial lower bound for mu

                    		
                  

                  

                    262
                    144x
                    
                      
			yp_minus <- yp_hat[i] * 0.95

                    		
                  

                  

                    263
                    144x
                    
                      
			while (f(yp_minus, returns[i], slice) > 0) yp_minus <- yp_minus * 0.95

                    		
                  

                  

                    264
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    265
                    
                    
                      
			# Run the iteration algorithm to find the lower confidence interval

                    		
                  

                  

                    266
                    144x
                    
                      
			yp_lower <- regula.falsi(yp_minus, yp_hat[i], returns[i], slice)

                    		
                  

                  

                    267
                    144x
                    
                      
			ci_lower[i] <- yp_lower

                    		
                  

                  

                    268
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    269
                    
                    
                      
			# Find initial upper bound for mu

                    		
                  

                  

                    270
                    144x
                    
                      
			yp_plus <- yp_hat[i] * 1.05

                    		
                  

                  

                    271
                    144x
                    
                      
			while (f(yp_plus, returns[i], slice) > 0) yp_plus <- yp_plus * 1.05

                    		
                  

                  

                    272
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    273
                    
                    
                      
			# Run the iteration algorithm to find the upper confidence interval

                    		
                  

                  

                    274
                    144x
                    
                      
			yp_upper <- regula.falsi(yp_hat[i], yp_plus, returns[i], slice)

                    		
                  

                  

                    275
                    144x
                    
                      
			ci_upper[i] <- yp_upper

                    		
                  

                  

                    276
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    277
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    278
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    279
                    
                    
                      
		# Return the results as a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    280
                    24x
                    
                      
		list(ci_lower = ci_lower, estimates = yp_hat, ci_upper = ci_upper)

                    		
                  

                  

                    281
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    282
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    283
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    284
                    
                    
                      
	# Run uncertainty quantification at each year in slices

                    		
                  

                  

                    285
                    24x
                    
                      
	lapply(1:length(slices), function (i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    286
                    24x
                    
                      
		if (length(slices) == 1) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    287
                    24x
                    
                      
			compute.uncertainty(yp_hat, slice_covariates[i])

                    		
                  

                  

                    288
                    
                    
                      
		} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    289
                    !
                    
                      
			compute.uncertainty(yp_hat[i, ], slice_covariates[i])

                    		
                  

                  

                    290
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    291
                    
                    
                      
	})

                    		
                  

                  

                    292
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    293
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' L-Kurtosis Method for Distribution Selection

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Selects a probability distribution by minimizing the absolute distance

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' between the theoretical L-kurtosis (\eqn{\tau_4}) and the sample L-kurtosis 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' (\eqn{t_4}). For 3-parameter distributions, we use the shape parameter that 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' best replicates the sample L-skewness (\eqn{t_3}) of the data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List; results of distribution selection:

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' - `method`: `"L-kurtosis"`

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' - `metrics`: A list of L-kurtosis metrics for each distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' - `recommendation`: Name of the distribution with the smallest L-kurtosis metric

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' This method computes the distance between the sample and theoretical L-kurtosis values at 

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' a fixed L-skewness. For three parameter distributions, the shape parameter that best 

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' replicates the sample L-skewness is derived using \link[stats]{optim}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{lmom.sample}, \link{ld.selection}, \link{z.selection}, \link[stats]{optim}

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' lk.selection(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'
