                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats optim

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
lk.selection <- function(data) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the sample L-moments for data and log(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    6x
                    
                      
	reg_t3_t4 <- lmom.sample(data)[3:4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    6x
                    
                      
	log_t3_t4 <- lmom.sample(log(data))[3:4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
	# Initialize list of metrics

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    6x
                    
                      
	metrics <- list()

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
	# Iterate through the list of distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    6x
                    
                      
	for (model in c("GUM", "NOR", "LNO", "GEV", "GLO", "GNO", "PE3", "LP3", "WEI")) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
		# Get distribution information

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    54x
                    
                      
		info <- models.info(model)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
		# Determine the sample L-moments (regular or log)

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    54x
                    
                      
		t3_t4 <- if (info$log) log_t3_t4 else reg_t3_t4

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute the L-kurtosis metric directly for two-parameter distributions 

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    54x
                    
                      
		if (info$n.params == 2) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    18x
                    
                      
			tau3_tau4 <- lmrxxx(model, c(0, 1))[3:4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    18x
                    
                      
			metrics[[model]] <- abs(tau3_tau4[2] - t3_t4[2])

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    18x
                    
                      
			next

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
		# Find the shape parameter with the same L-skewness as the data

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    36x
                    
                      
		objective <- function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    1099x
                    
                      
			tau3_tau4 <- lmrxxx(model, c(0, 1, i))[3:4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    1099x
                    
                      
			abs(tau3_tau4[1] - t3_t4[1])

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
		# Run optimization for three parameter distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    36x
                    
                      
		result <- optim(

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    36x
                    
                      
			par = (info$k.bounds[1] + info$k.bounds[2]) / 2,

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    36x
                    
                      
			fn = objective,

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    36x
                    
                      
			method = "Brent",

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    36x
                    
                      
			lower = info$k.bounds[1],

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    36x
                    
                      
			upper = info$k.bounds[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
		)

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
		# Get the parameters of the fitted distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    36x
                    
                      
		tau3_tau4 <- lmrxxx(model, c(0, 1, result$par))[3:4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    36x
                    
                      
		metrics[[model]] <- abs(tau3_tau4[2] - t3_t4[2])

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine the recommendation (distribution with lowest L-distance)

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    6x
                    
                      
	recommendation <- names(metrics)[which.min(metrics)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the results as a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    6x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    6x
                    
                      
		method = "L-kurtosis",

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    6x
                    
                      
		metrics = metrics, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    6x
                    
                      
		recommendation = recommendation

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
	)	

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Sample L-moments

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Computes the first four sample L-moments and L-moment ratios from a numeric 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' vector of data. L-moments are linear combinations of order statistics that 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' provide robust alternatives to conventional moments, with advantages in 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' parameter estimation for heavy-tailed and skewed distributions.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' Given probability weighted moments \eqn{\beta_0, \beta_1, \beta_2, \beta_3}, the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' first four sample L-moments are: 

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' - \eqn{l_1 = \beta_0}

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - \eqn{l_2 = 2\beta_1 - \beta_0}

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - \eqn{l_3 = 6\beta_2 - 6\beta_1 + \beta_0}

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - \eqn{l_4 = 20\beta_3 - 30\beta_2 + 12\beta_1 - \beta_0}

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' Then, the sample L-skewness is \eqn{t_3 = l_3 / l_2} and the sample L-kurtosis

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' is \eqn{t_4 = l_4 / l_2}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Numeric (4); a vector containing the first four L-moments and L-moment ratios:

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' - `l1`: L-mean

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' - `l2`: L-variance

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' - `t3`: L-skewness

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' - `t4`: L-kurtosis

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' lmom.sample(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @references

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' Hosking, J. R. M. (1990). L-moments: Analysis and estimation of distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' using linear combinations of order statistics. *Journal of the Royal Statistical

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' Society: Series B (Methodological)*, 52(1), 105–124.

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
lmom.sample <- function(data) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
	# Sort the data in increasing order

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    383215x
                    
                      
	x <- sort(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    383215x
                    
                      
	n <- length(x)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    383215x
                    
                      
	i <- 1:n

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
	# Recursively compute the probability weighted moments

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    383215x
                    
                      
	vb0 <- x / n

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    383215x
                    
                      
	vb1 <- vb0 * (i - 1) / (n - 1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    383215x
                    
                      
	vb2 <- vb1 * (i - 2) / (n - 2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    383215x
                    
                      
	vb3 <- vb2 * (i - 3) / (n - 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    383215x
                    
                      
	b0 <- sum(vb0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    383215x
                    
                      
	b1 <- sum(vb1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    383215x
                    
                      
	b2 <- sum(vb2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    383215x
                    
                      
	b3 <- sum(vb3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the first four sample L-moments

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    383215x
                    
                      
	l1 <- b0

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    383215x
                    
                      
	l2 <- (2 * b1) - b0

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    383215x
                    
                      
	l3 <- (6 * b2) - (6 * b1) + b0

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    383215x
                    
                      
	l4 <- (20 * b3) - (30 * b2) + (12 * b1) - b0

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the results (l1, l2, t3, t4)

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    383215x
                    
                      
	c(l1 ,l2, l3 / l2, l4 / l2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Plot Runs Test Results

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Generates a residual plot of Sen’s estimator applied to annual maximum streamflow

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' (AMS) data with a horizontal dashed line at zero and an annotation of the Runs 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' test p-value.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param years Numeric; a vector of years with the same length as `data`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @param results List; runs test results generated by \link{runs.test}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @param type Character; either `"variance"` or `"mean"`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @param show_trend Logical; if TRUE (default), draw a fitted line through the AMS data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @return `ggplot`; a plot containing:

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - Black points for the residual at each year.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - A red dashed horizontal line at \eqn{y = 0}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' - A text annotation “Runs p-value: X.XXX” in the plot area.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{runs.test}

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' # Initialize data and years

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' # Generate runs test plot 

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' residuals <- sens.trend(data, years)$residuals

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' results <- runs.test(residuals)

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' runs.plot(years, results, "sens-mean")

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' @import ggplot2

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom grid textGrob grobTree rectGrob gpar

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
runs.plot <- function(years, results, type) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
	# Set labels and data based on the name

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    1x
                    
                      
	if (type == "variance") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    !
                    
                      
		title <- "Sen's Estimator Residuals (AMS Variance)"

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
	} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    1x
                    
                      
		title <- "Sen's Estimator Residuals (AMS Mean)"

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
	# Generate dataframes for the trend estimate, data, and residuals

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    1x
                    
                      
	df_residuals <- data.frame(x = years, y = results$residuals)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
	# First subplot: Plot of residuals

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    1x
                    
                      
	p1 <- ggplot(df_residuals, aes(x = .data$x, y = .data$y)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    1x
                    
                      
		geom_point(color = "black", size = 2.25) + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    1x
                    
                      
	    geom_hline(yintercept = 0, color = "red", linetype = "dashed", linewidth = 1.2) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    1x
                    
                      
		labs(title = "Residual Plot", x = "Year", y = "Residual Value")

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
	# Add p-value annotation

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    1x
                    
                      
	runs_label <- sprintf("Runs p-value: %.3f", results$p.value)

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    1x
                    
                      
	p1 <- add_annotation(p1, runs_label)

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the plot with added theme

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    1x
                    
                      
	add_theme(add_scales(p1))

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
 

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Spearman Test for Autocorrelation

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Performs the Spearman rank autocorrelation test on annual maximum streamflow (AMS) data to

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' check for autocorrelation at various lags. Reports the first lag where the autocorrelation 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' is no longer statistically significant at the given significance level.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @param alpha Numeric (1); the significance level (default is 0.05).

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @param quiet Logical (1); if FALSE, prints a summary of results (default is TRUE).

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List; test results, including:

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `rho`: Vector of Spearman autocorrelation estimates for lags \eqn{1} to \eqn{n - 3}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - `sig`: Logical vector indicating which lags exhibit significant autocorrelation.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `least.lag`: The smallest lag at which the autocorrelation is not statistically significant.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reject`: Logical. TRUE if `least.lag > 0`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' - `msg`: Character string summarizing the test result (printed if `quiet = FALSE`).

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' For each lag from \eqn{1} to \eqn{n - 3}, the function computes the Spearman correlation 

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' coefficient between the AMS series and its lagged version. The first lag with an 

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' insignificant autocorrelation coefficient returned as `least.lag`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link[stats]{cor.test}, \link{bbmk.test}

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' spearman.test(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats cor.test

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
spearman.test <- function(data, alpha = 0.05, quiet = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
	# Assign a variable to the number of data points for convenience

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    9x
                    
                      
	n <- length(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the spearman rho-autocorrelation for a given lag

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    9x
                    
                      
	rho_autocorrelation <- function(lag, data) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    842x
                    
                      
		data_original <- data[(lag + 1):length(data)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    842x
                    
                      
		data_lagged <- data[1:(length(data) - lag)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    842x
                    
                      
		cor.test(data_original, data_lagged, method="spearman", exact=FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
	# Find the lowest non-significant serial correlation lag

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    9x
                    
                      
	rho <- numeric(n - 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    9x
                    
                      
	p_values <- numeric(n - 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    9x
                    
                      
	for (i in 1:(n - 3)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    842x
                    
                      
		result <- rho_autocorrelation(i, data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    842x
                    
                      
		rho[i] = result$estimate

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    842x
                    
                      
		p_values[i] = result$p.value

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    9x
                    
                      
	least_lag <- which(p_values > alpha)[1] - 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
	# Get a series of booleans for whether the serial correlation is significant

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    9x
                    
                      
	sig <- (p_values <= alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    9x
                    
                      
	reject <- (least_lag > 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
	# Print the results

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    9x
                    
                      
	l1 <- sprintf("The Spearman test found a least insignificant lag of %f.", least_lag)

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    9x
                    
                      
	l2 <- sprintf("There is %s evidence of serial correlation.", ifelse(reject, "", "NO"))

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    9x
                    
                      
	msg <- paste0("\n - ", c(l1, l2), collapse = "")

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    9x
                    
                      
	if (!quiet) message(msg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the results as a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    9x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    9x
                    
                      
		rho = rho,

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    9x
                    
                      
		sig = sig,

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    9x
                    
                      
		least.lag = least_lag,

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    9x
                    
                      
		reject = reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    9x
                    
                      
		msg = msg

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Plot Block‐Bootstrap Mann–Kendall Test Results

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Generates a histogram of bootstrapped Mann–Kendall S‐statistics with vertical

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' lines indicating the observed S‐statistic and confidence bounds.

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @param results List; BB‐MK test results generated by \link{bbmk.test}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @return \code{ggplot}; A plot containing:

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'   - A gray histogram of the distribution of bootstrapped S‐statistics.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'   - A red vertical line at the lower and upper confidence bounds.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'   - A black vertical line at the observed S‐statistic.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' results <- bbmk.test(data, n_sim = 1000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' bbmk.plot(results)

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @import ggplot2

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
bbmk.plot <- function(results) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    1x
                    
                      
	p1 <- ggplot() +

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    1x
                    
                      
		geom_histogram(

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    1x
                    
                      
			aes(x = results$s.bootstrap, color = "gray"), 

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    1x
                    
                      
			fill = "lightgray",

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    1x
                    
                      
			bins = 30

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
		)  +

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    1x
                    
                      
		geom_vline(aes(xintercept = results$bounds, color = "red"), linewidth = 1.2) + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    1x
                    
                      
		geom_vline(aes(xintercept = results$s.statistic, color = "black"), linewidth = 1.2) + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    1x
                    
                      
		labs(

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    1x
                    
                      
			title = "Block-Bootstrap Mann-Kendall Test",

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    1x
                    
                      
			x = "S-Statistic",

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    1x
                    
                      
			y = "Frequency",

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    1x
                    
                      
			color = "Legend"

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
		) + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    1x
                    
                      
		scale_color_manual(

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    1x
                    
                      
			values = c("gray" = "gray", "black" = "black", "red" = "red"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    1x
                    
                      
			breaks = c("gray", "black", "red"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    1x
                    
                      
			labels = c("Bootstrapped Statistics", "S-Statistic", "Confidence Bounds"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
		)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the plot with added theme

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    1x
                    
                      
	add_theme(p1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Generalized Log-Likelihood Functions for GEV Models

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Computes the generalized log-likelihood for stationary and non-stationary variants of the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Generalized Extreme Value (GEV) distribution with a Beta prior on the shape parameter.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' @details 

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' The generalized log-likelihood is defined as sum of the log-likelihood of the specified

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' model and the log-density of the Beta prior with parameters \eqn{(p, q)}. The contribution 

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' of the prior is: \deqn{\log \pi(\kappa) = (p-1) \log(0.5-\kappa) + (q-1) \log(0.5+\kappa) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' - \log (\beta(p, q))}

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' Each function corresponds to a different parameterization of the GEV model:

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - `gllgev()`: Stationary location and scale, 3 parameters.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `gllgev100()`: Time-varying location, stationary scale, 4 parameters.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - `gllgev110()`: Time-varying location and scale, 5 parameters.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @note

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' The `gllgev`, `gllgev100`, and `gllgev110` functions perform extensive parameter validation, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' which can be slow. If you plan to call these methods often, it is recommended to use 

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' the `gllxxx` helper function instead.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' @param params Numeric; a vector of parameters. Must have the correct length for the model.

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @param prior Numeric (2); a vector of parameters\eqn{(p, q)} of the Beta prior on \eqn{\kappa}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @param years Numeric; a vector of years with the same length as `data`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'   Only required for `gllgev100()` and `gllgev110()`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Numeric (1); the generalized log-likelihood value.

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{gllxxx}

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' # Initialize data, years, params, and prior

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' params <- c(0, 1, 1, 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' prior <- c(5, 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' # Compute the generalized log-likelihood

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#' gllgev100(data, params, prior, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' @name gll-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
gllvalidate <- function(n, data, params, prior, years = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
	# Validate the data vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    48x
                    
                      
	if (!is.numeric(data) | !is.vector(data)) stop("'data' must be a numeric vector.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    45x
                    
                      
	if (any(is.nan(data)) | any(is.na(data))) stop("'data' must not contain NaN/NA values.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    42x
                    
                      
	if (any(data <= 0)) stop("'data' must not contain negative values.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
	# Validate the parameter vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    39x
                    
                      
	if (!is.numeric(params) | !is.vector(params)) stop("'params' must be a numeric vector.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    36x
                    
                      
	if (any(is.nan(params)) | any(is.na(params))) stop("'params' must not contain NaN/NA values.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    33x
                    
                      
	if (length(params) != n) stop(sprintf("'params' must have length %d.", n))

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
	# Validate the prior vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    30x
                    
                      
	if (!is.numeric(prior) | !is.vector(prior)) stop("'prior' must be a numeric vector.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    27x
                    
                      
	if (any(is.nan(prior)) | any(is.na(prior))) stop("'prior' must not contain NaN/NA values.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    24x
                    
                      
	if (length(prior) != 2) stop("'prior' must have length 2.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
	# Validate the years vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    21x
                    
                      
	if (!is.null(years)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    16x
                    
                      
		if (!is.numeric(years) | !is.vector(years)) stop("'years' must be a numeric vector.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    14x
                    
                      
		if (any(is.nan(years)) | any(is.na(years))) stop("'years' must not contain NaN/NA values.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    12x
                    
                      
		if (length(years) != length(data)) stop("'years' must have the same length as 'data'.")

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname gll-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
gllgev    <- function(data, params, prior, years = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    14x
                    
                      
	gllvalidate(3, data, params, prior)

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    5x
                    
                      
	gllxxx("GEV", NULL, data, params, prior, NULL)

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname gll-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
gllgev100 <- function(data, params, prior, years) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    17x
                    
                      
	gllvalidate(4, data, params, prior, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    5x
                    
                      
	covariate <- get.covariates(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    5x
                    
                      
	gllxxx("GEV", "10", data, params, prior, covariate)

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname gll-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
gllgev110 <- function(data, params, prior, years) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    17x
                    
                      
	gllvalidate(5, data, params, prior, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    5x
                    
                      
	covariate <- get.covariates(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    5x
                    
                      
	gllxxx("GEV", "11", data, params, prior, covariate)

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Block-Bootstrap Mann-Kendall Test for Trend Detection

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Performs a bootstrapped version of the Mann-Kendall trend test to account

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' for serial correlation in annual maximum streamflow (AMS) data. The procedure

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' uses Spearman’s autocorrelation test to estimate the least insignificant lag, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' then applies a bootstrap procedure to obtain the empirical p-value and confidence 

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' bounds for the Mann-Kendall S-statistic.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @param alpha Numeric (1); the significance level (default is 0.05).

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @param n_sim Integer (1); the number of bootstrap simulations (default is 10000).

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'
