                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @param quiet Logical (1); if FALSE, prints a summary of results (default is TRUE).

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List; the results of the test, including:

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - `s.bootstrap`: Vector of bootstrapped test statistics used for plotting.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' - `s.statistic`: The Mann-Kendall test statistic computed on the original series.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' - `p.value`: Empirical two-sided p-value computed from the bootstrap distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' - `bounds`: Confidence interval bounds for the null distribution of the statistic.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reject`: Logical. TRUE if the null hypothesis was rejected at significance level alpha.

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' - `msg`: Character string summarizing the test result (printed if `quiet = FALSE`).

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' The block size for the bootstrap is selected as `least_lag + 1`, where `least_lag` 

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' is estimated using \link{spearman.test}. Each bootstrap sample is generated by 

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' resampling blocks of the original data  (without replacement) and computing the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' Mann-Kendall S-statistic. This procedure adjusts for autocorrelation in the data. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{mk.test}, \link{spearman.test}

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' bbmk.test(data, n_sim = 1000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats quantile

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
bbmk.test <- function(

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
  data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
  alpha = 0.05,

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
  n_sim = 10000,

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
  quiet = TRUE

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
	# Assign a variable to the number of data points for convenience

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    3x
                    
                      
	n <- length(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute least_lag and s_statistic from the Spearman and MK tests

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    3x
                    
                      
	least_lag <- spearman.test(data, alpha)$least.lag

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    3x
                    
                      
	s_statistic  <- mk.test(data, alpha)$s.statistic

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
	# Create blocks

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    3x
                    
                      
	block_size <- least_lag + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    3x
                    
                      
	n_blocks <- ceiling(n / block_size)

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    3x
                    
                      
	blocks <- split(data[1:(n_blocks * block_size)], rep(1:n_blocks, each = block_size))

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
	# Loop through the bootstrap in parallel

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    3x
                    
                      
	bootstrap_list <- lapply(1:n_sim, function(i) { 

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
		# Sample blocks for this iteration

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    20100x
                    
                      
		sampled_blocks <- sample(blocks, n_blocks, replace = FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    20100x
                    
                      
		sampled_data <- unlist(sampled_blocks, use.names = FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute the Mann-Kendall statistic for this iteration

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    20100x
                    
                      
		m <- outer(sampled_data, sampled_data, `-`)                   

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    20100x
                    
                      
  		s <- sum(sign(m[lower.tri(m)]), na.rm = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    20100x
                    
                      
		return (s)

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
	})

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    3x
                    
                      
	bootstrap_results <- as.numeric(bootstrap_list)

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the p-value empirically using the bootstrap distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    3x
                    
                      
	p_value <- ifelse(

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    3x
                    
                      
		s_statistic < 0, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    3x
                    
                      
		2 * mean(s_statistic >= bootstrap_results),

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    3x
                    
                      
		2 * mean(s_statistic <= bootstrap_results)

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the CI bounds

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    3x
                    
                      
	bounds <- quantile(bootstrap_results, c(alpha / 2, 1 - (alpha / 2)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine whether we reject or fail to reject based on p_value and alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    3x
                    
                      
	reject <- (p_value <= alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
	# Print the results of the test

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    3x
                    
                      
	msg <- test_message(

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    3x
                    
                      
		"BBMK",

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    3x
                    
                      
		reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    3x
                    
                      
		p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    3x
                    
                      
		alpha,

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    3x
                    
                      
		"evidence of a trend given the serial correlation.",

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    3x
                    
                      
		"NO evidence of a trend given the serial correlation."

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    3x
                    
                      
	if (!quiet) message(msg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the results as a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    3x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    3x
                    
                      
		s.bootstrap = bootstrap_results,

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    3x
                    
                      
		s.statistic = s_statistic,

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    3x
                    
                      
		p.value = p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    3x
                    
                      
		bounds = bounds,

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    3x
                    
                      
		reject = reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    3x
                    
                      
		msg = msg

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Sample Bootstrap Confidence Intervals for Flood Quantile Estimates

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Computes estimates and confidence intervals for return levels at standard return periods

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' (2, 5, 10, 20, 50, and 100 years) using the sample bootstrap method. This function 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' supports a variety of probability models and parameter estimation methods.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @param years Numeric; a vector of years with the same length as `data`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @param model Character (1); string specifying the probability model. The first three 

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'   letters denote the family: `GUM`, `NOR`, `LNO`, `GEV`, `GLO`, `GNO`, `PE3`, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'   `LP3`, or `WEI`. A trailing signature of `10` or `100` indicates a linear trend 

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'   in location; `11` or `110` indicates linear trends in both location and scale.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @param method Character (1); string specifying the estimation method. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'   Must be `"L-moments"`, `"MLE"`, or `"GMLE"`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @param slices Character (1) or Numeric; specifies the years at which

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'   to compute the estimates and confidence intervals (default is "last").

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'   - `"all"`: returns estimates for all values in `years`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'   - `"first"`: returns estimates for first year in the dataset.

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'   - `"last"`: returns estimates for last year in the dataset.

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Passing a numeric vector to `slices` allows for custom values.

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'   If the chosen model is stationary, the results will be the same for all slices.

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @param n_sim Integer (1); the number of bootstrap simulations (default is 10000).

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @param alpha Numeric (1); the significance level (default is 0.05).

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' @param prior Numeric (2); optional vector of parameters \eqn{(p, q)} that specifies 

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#'  the parameters of a Beta prior on \eqn{\kappa}. Only works with models `GEV`, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'  `GEV100`, and `GEV110`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List; quantiles and confidence intervals. Each year maps to a sub-list:

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' - `estimates`: Estimated quantiles for each return period.

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' - `ci_lower`: Lower bound of the confidence interval for each return period.

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' - `ci_upper`: Upper bound of the confidence interval for each return period.

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' - `t`: Vector of return periods; `c(2, 5, 10, 20, 50, 100)`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#' The bootstrap procedure samples from the fitted distribution via inverse 

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' transform sampling. For each bootstrapped sample, the parameters are re-estimated 

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' using the specified `method`. Then, the bootstrapped parameters are used to compute 

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' a new set of bootstrapped quantiles. Confidence intervals are obtained from the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' empirical non-exceedance probabilities of the bootstrapped quantiles.

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{pelxxx}, \link{mle.estimation}, \link{lmom.sample}, \link[stats]{quantile}

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#' sb.uncertainty(data, years, "WEI", "L-moments")

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats runif

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
sb.uncertainty <- function(

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
  data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
  years,

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
  model,

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
  method,

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
  slices = "last",

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
  n_sim = 10000,

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
  alpha = 0.05,

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
  prior = NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
	# Check if the method is invalid

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    28x
                    
                      
	if (!(method %in% c("L-moments", "MLE", "GMLE"))) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    !
                    
                      
		stop("Unsupported method: ", method)

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
	# Split the model into name and signature

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    28x
                    
                      
	name <- substr(model, 1, 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    28x
                    
                      
	signature <- if (nchar(model) == 3) NULL else substr(model, 4, 5)

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    28x
                    
                      
	year_covariates <- get.covariates(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
	# Set return periods and their quantiles

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    28x
                    
                      
    t <- c(2, 5, 10, 20, 50, 100)

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    28x
                    
                      
    returns <- 1 - (1 / t)

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    28x
                    
                      
    n <- length(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine the slices based on the "years" argument

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    28x
                    
                      
	if (is.character(slices)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    28x
                    
                      
		slices <- switch(

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    28x
                    
                      
			slices,

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    28x
                    
                      
			"all" = years,

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    28x
                    
                      
			"first" = min(years),

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    28x
                    
                      
			"last" = max(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
		)

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    28x
                    
                      
	slice_covariates <- get.covariates(slices)

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the estimation function

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    28x
                    
                      
	if (method == "L-moments") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    17x
                    
                      
		efunc <- function(data, years) pelxxx(name, data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    28x
                    
                      
	} else if (method == "MLE") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    10x
                    
                      
		efunc <- function(data, years) mle.estimation(data, years, model)$params

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    28x
                    
                      
	} else if (method == "GMLE") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    1x
                    
                      
		efunc <- function(data, years) mle.estimation(data, years, model, prior)$params

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      
	}	

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the estimated quantiles

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    28x
                    
                      
	params <- efunc(data, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    28x
                    
                      
	estimates <- qntxxx(name, signature, returns, params, slice_covariates)

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      
	# Generate the bootstrapped quantiles in parallel, one year at a time

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    28x
                    
                      
	quantiles <- sapply(1:n, function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    2795x
                    
                      
		u <- runif(n_sim)

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    2795x
                    
                      
		qntxxx(name, signature, u, params, year_covariates[i])

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    
                    
                      
	})

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    
                    
                      
	# Some distributions generate negative values. Adjust these to epsilon.

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    28x
                    
                      
	quantiles[quantiles < 0] = 1e-8

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    
                    
                      
	# Vectorized, parallel bootstrap function 

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    28x
                    
                      
	bootstrap_list <- lapply(1:n_sim, function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    183000x
                    
                      
		bootstrap_params <- efunc(quantiles[i, ], years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    183000x
                    
                      
		qntxxx(name, signature, returns, bootstrap_params, slice_covariates)

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    
                    
                      
	})

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    
                    
                      
	# Create a 3D array with dimensions (1: slices), (2: periods), (3: simulations)

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    28x
                    
                      
	bootstrap_array <- array(unlist(bootstrap_list), dim = c(length(slices), 6, n_sim))

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute confidence intervals

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    28x
                    
                      
	probs <- c(alpha / 2, 1 - (alpha / 2))

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    28x
                    
                      
	ci <- apply(bootstrap_array, c(2, 1), quantile, probs = probs)

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    
                    
                      
	# Generate the results as a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    28x
                    
                      
	results <- lapply(1:length(slices), function(k) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    331x
                    
                      
		ye <- if (length(slices) == 1) estimates else estimates[k, ]

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    331x
                    
                      
		list(t = t, ci_lower = ci[1, , k], estimates = ye, ci_upper = ci[2, , k])

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    
                    
                      
	})

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    28x
                    
                      
	names(results) <- slices

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    28x
                    
                      
	return(results)

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Plot Sen’s Trend Estimator

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Produces a scatter plot of the annual maximum streamflow (AMS) data or its variance

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' against time, overlaid with Sen’s trend estimator and an annotation of the fitted 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' equation.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @param years Numeric; a vector of years with the same length as `data`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @param results List; runs test results generated by \link{sens.trend}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @param type Character; either `"variance"` or `"mean"`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @param show_trend Logical; if TRUE (default), draw a fitted line through the AMS data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @return `ggplot`; a plot containing:

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' - Black points for each year’s AMS (or variance) value.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' - Optional black line connecting the AMS data if `show_trend = TRUE`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' - Blue line representing Sen’s trend estimator.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' - A text annotation displaying the fitted equation \eqn{y = mx + b}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{sens.trend}

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' results <- sens.trend(data, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' sens.plot(data, years, results, "mean")

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @import ggplot2

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom grid textGrob

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
sens.plot <- function(data, years, results, type, show_trend = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
	# Load the results of the test into the environment

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    1x
                    
                      
	m <- results$sens.slope

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    1x
                    
                      
	b <- results$sens.intercept

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
	# Set labels and data based on the type

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    1x
                    
                      
	if (type == "variance") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    !
                    
                      
		ams_label <- expression(AMS ~ Variance ~ m^3/s)

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    !
                    
                      
		title <- "Sen's Trend Estimator (AMS Variance)"

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
	} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    1x
                    
                      
		ams_label <- expression(AMS ~ m^3/s)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    1x
                    
                      
		title <- "Sen's Trend Estimator (AMS Mean)"

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
	# Generate dataframes for the trend estimate, data

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    1x
                    
                      
	covariate <- get.covariates(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    1x
                    
                      
	df_line <- data.frame(x = covariate, y = m * covariate + b)

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    1x
                    
                      
	df_data <- data.frame(x = covariate, y = data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
	# Generate the equation and runs test label 

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    1x
                    
                      
	eq_label <- sprintf("y = %.3fx + %.2f", m, b)

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
	# First subplot: Plot of Sen's trend estimator

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    1x
                    
                      
	p1 <- ggplot(df_data, aes(x = .data$x, y = .data$y)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    1x
                    
                      
		geom_point(aes(color = "black"), size = 2.25) + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    1x
                    
                      
		(if (show_trend) geom_line(color = "black", linewidth = 1.1) else NULL) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    1x
                    
                      
		geom_line(

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    1x
                    
                      
			data = df_line,

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    1x
                    
                      
			aes(x = .data$x, y = .data$y, color = "blue"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    1x
                    
                      
			linewidth = 1.2

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
		) + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    1x
                    
                      
		labs(title = title, x = "Covariate", y = ams_label, color = "Legend") + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    1x
                    
                      
		scale_color_manual(

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    1x
                    
                      
			values = c("blue" = "blue", "black" = "black"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    1x
                    
                      
			breaks = c("blue", "black"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    1x
                    
                      
			labels = c("Estimated Trend", ams_label),

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
		) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
	# Add equation annotation, scales, and theme

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    1x
                    
                      
	p1 <- add_annotation(p1, eq_label)

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    1x
                    
                      
	add_theme(add_scales(p1))

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
 

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Evaluate Goodness-of-Fit for Fitted Flood Models

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Computes multiple performance metrics and diagnostic indicators to assess the quality of

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' a fitted flood frequency model This includes residual statistics, information criteria,

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' and coverage-based metrics using bootstrapped confidence intervals.

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @param years Numeric; a vector of years with the same length as `data`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @param model Character; string specifying the probability model. The first three 

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'   letters denote the family: `GUM`, `NOR`, `LNO`, `GEV`, `GLO`, `GNO`, `PE3`, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'   `LP3`, or `WEI`. A trailing signature of `10` or `100` indicates a linear trend 

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'   in location; `11` or `110` indicates linear trends in both location and scale.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @param params Numeric; a vector of fitted model parameters generated by

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'   \link{pelxxx} or \link{mle.estimation}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @param uncertainty List; quantiles and confidence intervals

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'   generated by \link{sb.uncertainty} or \link{rfpl.uncertainty}. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @param pp.formula Character (1); string specifying the plotting position formula. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'   One of `"Weibull"`, `"Blom"`, `"Cunnane"`, `"Gringorten"`, or `"Hazen"`

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'   (default is "Weibull").

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @param alpha Numeric (1); the significance level (default is 0.05).

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List; model assessment metrics:

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' - `estimates`: Quantile estimates for empirical return periods.

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' - `R2`: Coefficient of determination from linear regression of estimates vs. data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' - `RMSE`: Root mean squared error of quantile estimates.

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' - `bias`: Mean bias of quantile estimates.

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' - `AIC`: Akaike Information Criterion.

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' - `BIC`: Bayesian Information Criterion.

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' - `AIC_MLL`: Akaike Information Criterion, computed using the maximum log-likelihood.

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' - `BIC_MLL`: Bayesian Information Criterion, computed using the maximum log-likelihood.

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' - `AW`: Average width of the confidence interval(s).

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' - `POC`: Percent of observations covered by the confidence interval(s).

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' - `CWI`: Confidence width index, a metric that combines `AW` and `POC`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{sb.uncertainty}, \link{rfpl.uncertainty}, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#'   \link[stats]{lm}, \link[stats]{approx}

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples 

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' # Initialize example data, years, and params

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' params <- c(100, 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#' # Perform uncertainty analysis

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#' uncertainty <- sb.uncertainty(data, years, "NOR", "L-moments")

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#' # Perform model assessment

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#' model.assessment(data, years, "NOR", params, uncertainty)

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats approx

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
model.assessment <- function(

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
  data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
  years,

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
  model,

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
  params,

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
  uncertainty,

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
  pp.formula = "Weibull",

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
  alpha = 0.05

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the name and signature for the model 

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    6x
                    
                      
	name <- substr(model, 1, 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    6x
                    
                      
	signature <- if(nchar(model) == 3) NULL else substr(model, 4, 5)

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
	# Sort the data vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    6x
                    
                      
	n <- length(data)                          

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    6x
                    
                      
	data_sorted <- data[order(data, decreasing = TRUE)]  

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
	# Sort the years on the decomposed data (this gets the "true" plotting positions)

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    6x
                    
                      
	data_decomposed <- ams.decomposition(data, years, signature)

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    6x
                    
                      
	years_sorted <- years[order(data_decomposed, decreasing = TRUE)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine empirical exceedance probabilities using the plotting position 

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    6x
                    
                      
	p_empirical <- switch(

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    6x
                    
                      
		pp.formula, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    6x
                    
                      
		Weibull = (1:n) / (n + 1),

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    6x
                    
                      
		Blom =  ((1:n) - 0.375) / (n + 0.25),

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    6x
                    
                      
		Cunnane = ((1:n) - 0.4) / (n + 0.2),

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    6x
                    
                      
		Gringorten = ((1:n) - 0.44) / (n + 0.12),

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    6x
                    
                      
		Hazen = ((1:n) - 0.5) / n

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    6x
                    
                      
	t_return <- 1 / p_empirical               

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the estimates, using the years as a covariate if necessary

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    6x
                    
                      
	estimates <- sapply(1:n, function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    578x
                    
                      
		covariate <- get.covariates(years_sorted[i])

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    578x
                    
                      
		qntxxx(name, signature, 1 - p_empirical[i], params, covariate)

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
	})

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
	# Run linear regression (stationary models only)

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    6x
                    
                      
	R2 <- summary(lm(estimates ~ data_sorted))$r.squared

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    6x
                    
                      
	RMSE <- sqrt(mean((estimates - data_sorted)^2))

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    6x
                    
                      
	bias <- mean(estimates - data_sorted)

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the AIC and BIC
