                    105
                    6x
                    
                      
	info <- models.info(model)

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    6x
                    
                      
	AIC <- n * log(RMSE) + (2 * info$n.params)

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    6x
                    
                      
	BIC <- n * log(RMSE) + (log(n) * info$n.params)

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the MLL AIC and BIC

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    6x
                    
                      
	MLL = mle.estimation(data, years, model)$mll

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    6x
                    
                      
	AIC_MLL = (2 * info$n.params) - (2 * MLL)

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    6x
                    
                      
	BIC_MLL = (info$n.params * log(n)) - (2 * MLL)

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    
                    
                      
	# Filter t_return and x to indices where t_return is between 2 and 100

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    6x
                    
                      
	idx <- (t_return > 2 & t_return < 100)

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    6x
                    
                      
	t_return <- t_return[idx]

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    6x
                    
                      
	data_sorted <- data_sorted[idx]

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    
                    
                      
		

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      
	# Define w, the width of the confidence interval at each year

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    6x
                    
                      
	w <- numeric(length(idx))

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    
                    
                      
	# Define covers, the count of data points within the confidence interval

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    6x
                    
                      
	covers <- 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    
                    
                      
	# Interpolate confidence intervals at empirical return periods

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    6x
                    
                      
	if (nchar(model == 3)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    
                    
                      
		# Use any of the confidence intervals for a stationary model

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    6x
                    
                      
		uncertainty <- uncertainty[[1]]

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    6x
                    
                      
		ci_lower <- approx(log(uncertainty$t), uncertainty$ci_lower, log(t_return))

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    6x
                    
                      
		ci_upper <- approx(log(uncertainty$t), uncertainty$ci_upper, log(t_return))

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    6x
                    
                      
		w <- ci_upper$y - ci_lower$y

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    6x
                    
                      
		covers <- sum(data_sorted < ci_upper$y & data_sorted > ci_lower$y)

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    
                    
                      
	} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    
                    
                      
		# Iterate through the confidence intervals for the non-stationary models 

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    !
                    
                      
		for (i in 1:length(w)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    !
                    
                      
			uncertainty <- uncertainty[[i]]

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    !
                    
                      
			ci_lower <- approx(log(uncertainty$t), uncertainty$ci_lower, log(t_return[i]))

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    !
                    
                      
			ci_upper <- approx(log(uncertainty$t), uncertainty$ci_upper, log(t_return[i]))

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    !
                    
                      
			w[i] <- ci_upper$y - ci_lower$y

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    
                    
                      
			# Add 1 to covers if data point i is within its confidence interval

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    !
                    
                      
			if (data_sorted[i] < ci_upper$y & data_sorted[i] > ci_lower$y) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    !
                    
                      
				covers <- covers + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    
                    
                      
			}

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the AW, POC, and CWI

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    6x
                    
                      
	AW <- mean(w)

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    6x
                    
                      
	POC <- 100 * covers / length(w)

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    6x
                    
                      
	CWI <- AW * exp((1 - alpha) - (POC / 100))^2

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    
                    
                      
	# Return assessment results in a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    6x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    6x
                    
                      
		estimates = estimates,

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    6x
                    
                      
		R2 = R2,

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    6x
                    
                      
		RMSE = RMSE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    6x
                    
                      
		bias = bias,

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    6x
                    
                      
		AIC = AIC,	

                    		
                  

                  

                    164
                    6x
                    
                      
		BIC = BIC,

                    		
                  

                  

                    165
                    6x
                    
                      
		AIC_MLL = AIC_MLL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    166
                    6x
                    
                      
		BIC_MLL = BIC_MLL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    167
                    6x
                    
                      
		AW = AW,

                    		
                  

                  

                    168
                    6x
                    
                      
		POC = POC,

                    		
                  

                  

                    169
                    6x
                    
                      
		CWI = CWI

                    		
                  

                  

                    170
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    171
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    172
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Generalized Log-Likelihood Helper Function

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' A helper function used by \link{gllgev}, \link{gllgev100}, and \link{gllgev110}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' @note 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' This function does not perform parameter validation, which improves performance

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' but may cause unpredictable behaviour. Use at your own risk.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @param name Character (1); the name of the probability distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @param signature Character (1); the non-stationary signature (`NULL`, `"10"`, or `"11"`).

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @param params Numeric; a vector of parameters. Must have the correct length for the model.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @param prior Numeric (2); a vector of parameters \eqn{(p, q)} of the Beta prior 

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'   on \eqn{\kappa}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @param covariate Numeric; a vector with the same length as `data`. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'   Required if `signature` is `"10"` or `"11"`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Numeric (1); the generalized log-likelihood value.

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{gll-functions}

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' # Initialize data, params, params, prior, and covariate

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' params <- c(0, 1, 1, 0, 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' prior <- c(5, 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' covariate <- seq(0, 1, length.out = 100)

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' # Compute the generalized log-likelihood

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' gllxxx("GEV", "11", data, params, prior, covariate)

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
gllxxx <- function(name, signature, data, params, prior, covariate = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
	# The prior is Beta(p, q)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    738320x
                    
                      
	p <- prior[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    738320x
                    
                      
	q <- prior[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the contribution of the prior to the likelihood

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    738320x
                    
                      
	k <- params[length(params)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    738320x
                    
                      
	pll <- (p - 1) * log(0.5 - k) + (q - 1) * log(0.5 + k) - lbeta(p, q)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the likelihood

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    738320x
                    
                      
	llv <- llvxxx(name, signature, data, params, covariate)

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the sum of (pll, llv) over all the data points

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    738320x
                    
                      
	n <- length(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    738320x
                    
                      
	sum((n * pll) + llv)

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Pettitt Test for Abrupt Changes in the Mean of a Time Series

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Performs the non-parametric Pettitt test to detect a single change point in the

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' mean of a time series, often used for abrupt shifts in hydrological data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param years Numeric; a vector of years with the same length as `data`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @param alpha Numeric (1); the significance level (default is 0.05).

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @param quiet Logical (1); if FALSE, prints a summary of results (default is TRUE).

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A named list containing:

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `ut`: Vector of absolute U-statistics for all time indices.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - `k.statistic`: Maximum absolute U-statistic (test statistic).

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `k.critical`: Critical K-statistic value for given `alpha`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - `p.value`: Approximate p-value for the test.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' - `change.index`: Index of the detected change point (0 if none).

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' - `change.year`: Year of the detected change point (0 if none).

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reject`: Logical. TRUE if the null hypothesis was rejected.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' - `msg`: Formatted summary message describing the test result.

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' The Pettitt test is a rank-based non-parametric test that evaluates the

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' hypothesis of a change point in the median/mean of a time series.

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' It computes the maximum of the absolute value of the U-statistic over all

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' possible split points. The p-value is approximated using an asymptotic formula.

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{pettitt.plot}

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' pettitt.test(data, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
 

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
pettitt.test <- function(data, years, alpha = 0.05, quiet = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
	# Extract the length of data for convenience

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    6x
                    
                      
	n <- length(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the U-statistic for all t-values from 1 to n

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    6x
                    
                      
	ut <- numeric(n)

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    6x
                    
                      
	for (t in 1:n) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    579x
                    
                      
		u <- 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
		# ut = sum(sign(data[j] - data[i])) for all i <= t, j > t

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    579x
                    
                      
		for (i in 1:t) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    28378x
                    
                      
			for (j in min(t + 1, n):n) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    913986x
                    
                      
				u = u + sign(data[j] - data[i])

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
			}

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    579x
                    
                      
		ut[t] = abs(u)

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
	# The K-statistic is the maximum absolute value of the U-statistics

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    6x
                    
                      
	k_statistic <- max(ut)

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the p-value using an approximate formula

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    6x
                    
                      
	p_value <- round(exp((-6 * k_statistic^2) / (n^3 + n^2)), digits=3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
	# Find the minimum statistically significant K-statistic 

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    6x
                    
                      
	k_critical <- (-log(alpha) * ((n^3) + (n^2)) / 6)^0.5;

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine the change index if the change is statistically significant

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    6x
                    
                      
	reject <- (p_value <= alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    6x
                    
                      
	change_index <- ifelse(reject, which.max(ut), 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    6x
                    
                      
	change_year <- ifelse(reject, years[change_index], 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
	# Print the results of the test

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    6x
                    
                      
	msg <- test_message(

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    6x
                    
                      
		"Pettitt",

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    6x
                    
                      
		reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    6x
                    
                      
		p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    6x
                    
                      
		alpha,

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    6x
                    
                      
		"NO evidence of a change point",

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    6x
                    
                      
		sprintf("evidence of a change point in %f", change_year)

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    6x
                    
                      
	if (!quiet) message(msg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
	# Return a list containing the results of the test

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    6x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    6x
                    
                      
		ut = ut,

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    6x
                    
                      
		k.statistic = k_statistic,

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    6x
                    
                      
		k.critical = k_critical,

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    6x
                    
                      
		p.value = p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    6x
                    
                      
		change.index = change_index,

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    6x
                    
                      
		change.year = change_year,

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    6x
                    
                      
		reject = reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    6x
                    
                      
		msg = msg

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Mann–Kendall–Sneyers Test for Change Point Detection

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Performs the Mann–Kendall–Sneyers (MKS) test to detect the beginning of a monotonic

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' trend in annual maximum streamflow (AMS) data. The test computes normalized

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' progressive and regressive Mann–Kendall statistics and identifies statistically

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' significant crossing points, indicating potential change points in the trend.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @param years Numeric; a vector of years with the same length as `data`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @param alpha Numeric (1); the significance level (default is 0.05).

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @param quiet Logical (1); if FALSE, prints a summary of results (default is TRUE).

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List; results of the MKS test:

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `s.progressive`: Normalized progressive Mann–Kendall statistics.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - `s.regressive`: Normalized regressive Mann–Kendall statistics.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' - `bound`: Critical confidence bound for significance based on `alpha`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' - `crossing.df`: Data frame of crossing points with indices, years, statistics, and AMS.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' - `change.df`: Subset of `crossing.df` with statistically significant crossings.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' - `p.value`: Two-sided p-value assessing the significance of maximum crossing statistic.

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reject`: Logical indicating whether null hypothesis of no change point is rejected.

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' - `msg`: Character string summarizing the test result (printed if `quiet = FALSE`).

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' The function computes progressive and regressive Mann–Kendall statistics \eqn{S_t},

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' normalized by their expected values and variances under the null hypothesis. The crossing

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' points where the difference between these normalized statistics changes sign are

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' identified using linear interpolation. The significance of detected crossings is

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' assessed using normal quantiles and the maximum absolute crossing statistic.

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' @references

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' Sneyers, R. (1990). On the statistical analysis of series of observations.

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' Technical note No. 143, World Meteorological Organization, Geneva.

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{mks.plot}

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' mks.test(data, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats pnorm qnorm lm coef

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
mks.test <- function(data, years, alpha = 0.05, quiet = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute number of elements such that data[i] > data[j] for all j < i < t for all t.

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    6x
                    
                      
	s_statistic <- function(vt, data) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
		# Computes the number of elements such that data[i] > data[j] for j < i (given i).

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    12x
                    
                      
		sum_i <- function(i) sum(data[i] > data[1:i-1])

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
		# Applies the sum_i function to a vector values.

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    12x
                    
                      
		n_i <- sapply(vt, sum_i)

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute cumulative sum of n_i values to get the S-statistic for all t.

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    12x
                    
                      
		cumsum(n_i)

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the forward and backwards s-statistics

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    6x
                    
                      
	idx <- 1:length(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    6x
                    
                      
	s_prog_non_normal <- s_statistic(idx, data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    6x
                    
                      
	s_regr_non_normal <- s_statistic(idx, rev(data))

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the variance and expectation of the S-statistics

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    6x
                    
                      
	s_expectation = idx * (idx - 1) / 4

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    6x
                    
                      
	s_variance = (idx * (idx - 1) * ((2 * idx) + 5)) / 72

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
	# Prevent a division by zero error at idx = 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    6x
                    
                      
	s_variance[s_variance == 0] <- 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the normalized progressive and regressive s-statistics

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    6x
                    
                      
	s_prog <- (s_prog_non_normal - s_expectation) / sqrt(s_variance)

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    6x
                    
                      
	s_regr <- rev((s_regr_non_normal - s_expectation) / sqrt(s_variance))

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute confidence bounds for the normalized s-statistics

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    6x
                    
                      
	bound <- qnorm(1 - (alpha / 2))

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
	# Find all crossings between progressive/regressive series

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
	# Increment by one so that the crossing index is the start of the time series

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    6x
                    
                      
	s_sign <- sign(s_prog - s_regr)

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    6x
                    
                      
	cross <- which(s_sign[-1] != s_sign[-length(s_sign)]) + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the location of each crossing using linear interpolation

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    6x
                    
                      
	get_crossings <- function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
		# Fit linear models 

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    16x
                    
                      
		fit_prog <- lm(s_prog[(i - 1):i] ~ years[(i - 1):i])

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    16x
                    
                      
		fit_regr <- lm(s_regr[(i - 1):i] ~ years[(i - 1):i])

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
		# Get the slope and y-intercept of each line

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    16x
                    
                      
		b_prog <- coef(fit_prog)[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    16x
                    
                      
		b_regr <- coef(fit_regr)[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    16x
                    
                      
		m_prog <- coef(fit_prog)[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    16x
                    
                      
		m_regr <- coef(fit_regr)[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute and return y-coordinate of the intersection point

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    16x
                    
                      
		x_inter = (b_regr - b_prog) / (m_prog - m_regr)

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    16x
                    
                      
		y_inter = (m_prog * x_inter) + b_prog

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    16x
                    
                      
		as.numeric(y_inter)

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      
	# Get crossing locations

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    6x
                    
                      
	locations <- if (length(cross) == 0) numeric() else sapply(cross, get_crossings)

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      
	# Create a dataframe of all crossings

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    6x
                    
                      
	crossing_df <- data.frame(

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    6x
                    
                      
		cross = cross,

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    6x
                    
                      
		years = years[cross],

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    6x
                    
                      
		statistic = locations,

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    6x
                    
                      
		max = data[cross]

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the p-value of the test and the statistically significant crossings

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    6x
                    
                      
	if (nrow(crossing_df) > 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    4x
                    
                      
		p_value <- 2 * (1 - pnorm(max(abs(crossing_df$statistic))))

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    4x
                    
                      
		change_df <- crossing_df[which(abs(crossing_df$statistic) > bound), ]

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    
                    
                      
	} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    2x
                    
                      
		p_value <- 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    2x
                    
                      
		change_df <- crossing_df

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine whether we reject or fail to reject based on p_value and alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    6x
                    
                      
	reject <- (p_value <= alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    
                    
                      
	# Print the results of the test

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    6x
                    
                      
	msg <- test_message(

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    6x
                    
                      
		"Mann-Kendall-Sneyers",

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    6x
                    
                      
		reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    6x
                    
                      
		p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    6x
                    
                      
		alpha,

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    6x
                    
                      
		"NO evidence of change point(s)",

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    6x
                    
                      
		sprintf("evidence of change point(s) at %s", toString(change_df$years))

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    6x
                    
                      
	if (!quiet) message(msg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    
                    
                      
	# Return a list of values results from the test

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    6x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    6x
                    
                      
		s.progressive = s_prog,

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    6x
                    
                      
		s.regressive = s_regr,

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    6x
                    
                      
		bound = bound,

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    6x
                    
                      
		crossing.df = crossing_df,

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    6x
                    
                      
		change.df = change_df,

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    6x
                    
                      
		p.value = p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    6x
                    
                      
		reject = reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    6x
                    
                      
		msg = msg

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    
                    
                      
	

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' White Test for Heteroskedasticity

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Performs the White test for heteroskedasticity by regressing the squared residuals of a 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' linear model on the original regressors and their squared terms. The null hypothesis 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' is homoskedasticity.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @param years Numeric; a vector of years with the same length as `data`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @param alpha Numeric (1); the significance level (default is 0.05).

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @param quiet Logical (1); if FALSE, prints a summary of results (default is TRUE).

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List; results of the White test:

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `r.squared`: Coefficient of determination from the auxiliary regression.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - `statistic`: White test statistic based on sample size and `r.squared`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' - `p.value`: P-value derived from a Chi-squared distribution with 2 degrees of freedom.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reject`: Logical. TRUE if the null hypothesis is rejected at significance `alpha`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' - `msg`: Character string summarizing the test result (printed if `quiet = FALSE`).

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' The White test regresses the squared residuals from a primary linear model 

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' `lm(data ~ years)` against both the original regressor and its square. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' The test statistic is calculated as \eqn{nR^2}, where \eqn{R^2} is the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' coefficient of determination from the auxiliary regression. Under the null hypothesis,

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' this statistic follows a \eqn{\chi^2} distribution with 2 degrees of freedom.

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' Rejection of the null hypothesis suggests heteroskedasticity in the residuals.

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @references White, H. (1980). A heteroskedasticity-consistent covariance matrix 

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' estimator and a direct test for heteroskedasticity. \emph{Econometrica}, 48(4), 817–838.

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link[stats]{lm}, \link[stats]{pchisq}

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' white.test(data, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats lm pchisq resid

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
white.test <- function(data, years, alpha = 0.05, quiet = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
	# Do a linear regression of data against years, get the squared residuals

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    5x
                    
                      
	primary_model <- lm(data ~ years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    5x
                    
                      
	squared_residuals <- resid(primary_model)^2

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
	# Fit an auxillary model to the squared residuals, get the R^2 statistic

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    5x
