	auxillary_model <- lm(squared_residuals ~ years + I(years^2))

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    5x
                    
                      
	r_squared <- summary(auxillary_model)$r.squared

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the test statistic and p-value

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    5x
                    
                      
	statistic <- length(data) * r_squared

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    5x
                    
                      
	p_value <- 1 - pchisq(statistic, df = 2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine whether we reject or fail to reject based on p_value and alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    5x
                    
                      
	reject <- (p_value <= alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
	# Print the results of the test

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    5x
                    
                      
	msg <- test_message(

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    5x
                    
                      
		"White",

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    5x
                    
                      
		reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    5x
                    
                      
		p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    5x
                    
                      
		alpha,

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    5x
                    
                      
		"evidence of heteroskedasticity",

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    5x
                    
                      
		"evidence of homoskedasticity"

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
	

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    5x
                    
                      
	if (!quiet) message(msg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the results of the test

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    5x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    5x
                    
                      
		r.squared = r_squared,

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    5x
                    
                      
		statistic = statistic,

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    5x
                    
                      
		p.value = p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    5x
                    
                      
		reject = reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    5x
                    
                      
		msg = msg

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Estimate Variance for Annual Maximum Streamflow Data 

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' This function estimates the standard deviation of a vector of annual maximum 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' streamflow (AMS) data using a moving window algorithm, returning a list that

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' pairs each window’s mean year with its computed standard deviation. The 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' parameters `size` and `step` parameters control the behaviour of the window.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @param years Numeric; a vector of years with the same length as `data`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @param size Integer (1); the number of consecutive indices in each moving

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'   window. Must be a positive integer less than or equal to `length(data)`

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'   (default is 10). If `length(data) < size`, an error is raised.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @param step Integer (1); the offset (in indices) between successive moving 

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'   windows. Must be a positive integer (default is 5).

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list with two entries:

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' - `years`: Numeric; the mean year within each window.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' - `std`: Numeric; the standard deviation of the data within each window.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' mw.variance(data, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats sd

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
mw.variance <- function(data, years, size = 10, step = 5) { 

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
	# Check that the data vector is sufficiently large

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    14x
                    
                      
	n <- length(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    14x
                    
                      
  	if (n < size) stop(sprintf("Not enough data (%d < %d).", n, size))

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
	# Create df_variance, which contains the variances of the AMS data

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    13x
                    
                      
	std_series <- c()

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    13x
                    
                      
	year_series <- c()

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    13x
                    
                      
	location <- min(years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
	# Iterate through all the windows

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    13x
                    
                      
	while (location <= max(years) - size + 1) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
		# Get the window of indices based on the current location

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    246x
                    
                      
		window <- which(years >= location & years < location + size)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute the standard deviation within the window, add it to std_series

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    246x
                    
                      
		std <- sd(data[window])

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    246x
                    
                      
		std_series <- c(std_series, std)

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute the mean within the window, add it to year_series

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    246x
                    
                      
		year <- mean(years[window])

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    246x
                    
                      
		year_series <- c(year_series, year)

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
		# Increment the location by step

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    246x
                    
                      
		location <- location + step

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
	# Return moving window variances as a dataframe

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    13x
                    
                      
	list(years = year_series, std = std_series)

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Z-Statistic Method for Distribution Selection

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Selects the best-fit distribution by computing a bias-corrected Z-statistic for the sample

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' L-kurtosis (\eqn{\tau_4}) against the theoretical L-moments for a set of candidate

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' distributions. The distribution with the smallest absolute Z-score is selected.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @param n_sim Integer (1); the number of bootstrap simulations (default is 20000).

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List; results of distribution selection:

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' - `method`: `"Z-selection"`

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - `params`: Kappa distribution parameters for the raw AMS data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `log_params`: Kappa distribution parameters for the log-transformed AMS data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - `bootstrap`: Bias and standard deviation of the estimated L-kurtosis.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `distance`: List of computed Z-statistics for each candidate distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - `recommendation`: Name of the distribution with the smallest Z-statistic.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' The method performs model selection using both raw and log-transformed data. The 

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' distributions which use the raw AMS data are GEV, GLO, PE3, GNO, and WEI. The LP3

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' distribution uses log-transformed data. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' The Z-statistic is determined by fitting a four-parameter Kappa distribution to the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' raw and log-transformed data. Then, bootstrapped samples from this Kappa distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' The L-moments of these bootstrapped samples are used to estimate the Z-statistic 

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' for each distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{ld.selection}, \link{lk.selection}, \link{pelkap}, \link{qntxxx}

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' z.selection(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats runif optim

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
z.selection <- function(data, n_sim = 20000) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
	# Helper function that attempts to fit a Kappa distribution and draw a bootstrap

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    6x
                    
                      
	get_bootstrap <- function(data) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
		# Get the sample L-moments for the data

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    12x
                    
                      
		moments <- lmom.sample(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    12x
                    
                      
		sample_l1 <- moments[1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    12x
                    
                      
		sample_l2 <- moments[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    12x
                    
                      
		sample_t3 <- moments[3]

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    12x
                    
                      
		sample_t4 <- moments[4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
		# Check that the smaple L-moments are viable

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    12x
                    
                      
		if (sample_t4 > (1 + 5 * sample_t3^2) / 6) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    2x
                    
                      
			return (NULL)

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
		# Attempt to fit the Kappa distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    10x
                    
                      
		params <- pelkap(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
		# Generate a bootstrap from this Kappa distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    10x
                    
                      
		t4_list <- lapply(1:n_sim, function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    2e+05x
                    
                      
			u <- runif(length(data))	

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    2e+05x
                    
                      
			lmom.sample(qntkap(u, params))[4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
		})

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    10x
                    
                      
		t4 <- as.numeric(t4_list)

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute bias and standard deviation of t4 estimates

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    10x
                    
                      
		bias_t4 <- mean(t4 - sample_t4)

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    10x
                    
                      
		sd_t4 <- sqrt(mean((t4 - sample_t4)^2) - bias_t4^2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
		# Return the results as a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    10x
                    
                      
		list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    10x
                    
                      
			params = params,

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    10x
                    
                      
			sample_t3 = sample_t3,

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    10x
                    
                      
			sample_t4 = sample_t4,

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    10x
                    
                      
			t4 = t4,

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    10x
                    
                      
			bias_t4 = bias_t4,

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    10x
                    
                      
			sd_t4 = sd_t4

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
		)

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
	# Attempt to fit kappa distribution to the data

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    6x
                    
                      
	reg_bootstrap <- get_bootstrap(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
	# Attempt to fit kappa distribution to log(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    6x
                    
                      
	log_bootstrap <- get_bootstrap(log(data))

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
	# Initialize list of metrics

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    6x
                    
                      
	metrics <- list()

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
	# Iterate through the list of three parameter distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    6x
                    
                      
	for (model in c("GEV", "GLO", "GNO", "PE3", "LP3", "WEI")) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      
		# Get distribution information

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    36x
                    
                      
		info <- models.info(model)

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
		# Get the correct bootstrap

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    36x
                    
                      
		if (info$log & !is.null(log_bootstrap)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    4x
                    
                      
			bootstrap <- log_bootstrap

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    36x
                    
                      
		} else if (!info$log & !is.null(reg_bootstrap)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    30x
                    
                      
			bootstrap <- reg_bootstrap

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      
		} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    2x
                    
                      
			next

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      
		# Find the shape parameter with the same L-skewness as the data

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    34x
                    
                      
		objective <- function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    1033x
                    
                      
			distribution_t3 <- lmrxxx(model, c(0, 1, i))[3]

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    1033x
                    
                      
			abs(distribution_t3 - bootstrap$sample_t3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      
		# Run optimization for three parameter distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    34x
                    
                      
		result <- optim(

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    34x
                    
                      
			par = (info$k.bounds[1] + info$k.bounds[2]) / 2,

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    34x
                    
                      
			fn = objective,

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    34x
                    
                      
			method = "Brent",

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    34x
                    
                      
			lower = info$k.bounds[1],

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    34x
                    
                      
			upper = info$k.bounds[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    
                    
                      
		)

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    
                    
                      
		# Get the parameters of the fitted distribution and compute the z-score

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    34x
                    
                      
		distribution_t4 <- lmrxxx(model, c(0, 1, result$par))[4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    34x
                    
                      
		z <- (distribution_t4 - bootstrap$sample_t4 + bootstrap$bias_t4) / bootstrap$sd_t4

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    34x
                    
                      
		metrics[[model]] <- z

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine the recommendation (distribution with lowest L-distance)

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    6x
                    
                      
	index <- which.min(abs(unlist(metrics)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    6x
                    
                      
	recommendation <- names(metrics)[index]

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the results as a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    6x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    6x
                    
                      
		method = "Z-statistic",

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    6x
                    
                      
		params = reg_bootstrap$params,

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    6x
                    
                      
		log_params = log_bootstrap$params,

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    6x
                    
                      
		bootstrap = list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    6x
                    
                      
			bias_t4 = reg_bootstrap$bias_t4,

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    6x
                    
                      
			sd_t4 = reg_bootstrap$sd_t4,

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    6x
                    
                      
			log_bias_t4 = log_bootstrap$bias_t4,

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    6x
                    
                      
			log_sd_t4 = log_bootstrap$sd_t4

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    
                    
                      
		),

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    6x
                    
                      
		metrics = metrics,

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    6x
                    
                      
		recommendation = recommendation

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Kwiatkowski–Phillips–Schmidt–Shin (KPSS) Unit Root Test

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Performs the KPSS unit root test on annual maximum streamflow (AMS) data. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' The null hypothesis is that  the time series is trend-stationary with a linear 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' trend and constant drift.  The alternative hypothesis is that the time series 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' has a unit root and is non-stationary.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @param alpha Numeric (1); the significance level (default is 0.05).

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @param quiet Logical (1); if FALSE, prints a summary of results (default is TRUE).

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List; the test results, consisting of:

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `statistic`: The KPSS test statistic.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - `p.value`: The reported p-value from the test. See notes regarding discrete thresholds.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reject`: Logical. TRUE if the null hypothesis is rejected at `alpha`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - `msg`: Character string summarizing the test outcome, printed if `quiet = FALSE`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' The implementation of the KPSS test is based on the \pkg{aTSA} package, which interpolates

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' a significance table from Hobjin et al. (2004). Therefore, a result of \eqn{p = 0.01} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' implies that \eqn{p \leq 0.01} and a result of \eqn{p = 0.10} implies that \eqn{p \geq 0.10}. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' This implementation uses the Type III KPSS test, which accounts for a linear trend in the data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{pp.test}

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @references

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' Hobijn, B., Franses, P.H. and Ooms, M. (2004), Generalizations of the KPSS-test for 

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' stationarity. Statistica Neerlandica, 58: 483-502. 

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' kpss.test(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats embed

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
kpss.test <- function(data, alpha = 0.05, quiet = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
	# Construct time series yt and shifted time series yt1 for fitting the autoregressive model 

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    5x
                    
                      
	z <- embed(data, 2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    5x
                    
                      
	yt <- z[,1]

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    5x
                    
                      
	yt1 <- z[,2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
	# Set the number of lags using the standard choice, proportional to n^(1/2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    5x
                    
                      
	n <- length(yt)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    5x
                    
                      
	q <- max(1, floor(3 * sqrt(n) / 13))

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
	# Create an autoregressive model with drift and trend (yt as a function of yt1 and t) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    5x
                    
                      
	t <- 1:n

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    5x
                    
                      
    model <- lm(yt ~ yt1 + t)

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the residuals and their cumulative sum of squares

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    5x
                    
                      
	residuals <- resid(model)

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    5x
                    
                      
	Sk <- cumsum(residuals)^2

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the sample autocovariances

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    5x
                    
                      
	gamma <- numeric(q + 1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    5x
                    
                      
	for (i in 1:(q + 1)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    15x
                    
                      
		u <- embed(residuals,i)

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    15x
                    
                      
		gamma[i] = sum(u[,1] * u[,i]) / n

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute an estimator of the long-run variance 

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    5x
                    
                      
	lambda_hat <- gamma[1] + 2*sum((1 - 1:q/(q + 1))*gamma[-1])

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    5x
                    
                      
	statistic <- sum(Sk) / (lambda_hat * n^2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
	# Define table of quantiles and test statistic values from Hobjin et al. (2004)

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    5x
                    
                      
	quantiles <- c(0.10, 0.05, 0.025, 0.01)

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    5x
                    
                      
    table <- c(0.119, 0.146, 0.176, 0.216)

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
	# Interpolate the p-value

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    5x
                    
                      
	p_value <- approx(table, quantiles, statistic, rule = 2)$y

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine whether we reject or fail to reject based on p_value and alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    5x
                    
                      
	reject <- if (alpha == 0.10) p_value < alpha else p_value <= alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
	# Set the P-value text to inform the user of the limited significance thresholds

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    5x
                    
                      
	p_text <- if (p_value == 0.10) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    4x
                    
                      
		"*at least* 0.10"

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    5x
                    
                      
	} else if (p_value == 0.01) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    !
                    
                      
		"*at most* 0.01"

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
	} else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    1x
                    
                      
		round(p_value, 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
	# Print the results of the test

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    5x
                    
                      
	msg <- test_message(

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    5x
                    
                      
		"KPSS",

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    5x
                    
                      
		reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    5x
                    
                      
		p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    5x
                    
                      
		alpha,

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    5x
                    
                      
		"NO evidence of a unit root.",

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    5x
                    
                      
		"evidence of a unit root."

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    5x
                    
                      
	if (!quiet) message(msg)

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the results

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    5x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    5x
                    
                      
		statistic = statistic,

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    5x
                    
                      
		p.value = p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    5x
                    
                      
		reject = reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    5x
                    
                      
		msg = msg

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' L-Distance Method for Distribution Selection

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Selects a distribution from a set of candidate distributions by minimizing the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' Euclidean distance between the theoretical L-moment ratios \eqn{(\tau_3, \tau_4)} 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' and the sample L-moment ratios \eqn{(t_3, t_4)}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List; results of distribution selection:

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' - `method`: `"L-distance"`

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' - `metrics`: A list of L-distance metrics for each candidate distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' - `recommendation`: The name of the distribution with the smallest L-distance.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' For each candidate distribution, the method computes the Euclidean distance between

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' sample L-moment ratios (\eqn{\tau_3}, \eqn{\tau_4}) and the closest point on the

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' theoretical distribution's L-moment curve. For two-parameter distributions (Gumbel,

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' Normal, Log-Normal), the theoretical L-moment ratios are compared directly with

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' the sample L-moment ratios. The distribution with the minimum distance is selected.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' If a distribution is fit to log-transformed data (Log-Normal or Log-Pearson Type III), 

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' the L-moment ratios for the log-transformed sample are used instead.

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{lmom.sample}, \link{lk.selection}, \link{z.selection}, \link[stats]{optim}

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' ld.selection(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats optim

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
ld.selection <- function(data) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the sample L-moments for data and log(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    6x
                    
                      
	reg_t3_t4 <- lmom.sample(data)[3:4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    6x
                    
                      
	log_t3_t4 <- lmom.sample(log(data))[3:4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
	# Helper function to get distance between two points

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    6x
                    
                      
	distance <- function(p1, p2) sqrt((p1[1] - p2[1])^2 + (p1[2] - p2[2])^2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
	# Initialize list of metrics

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    6x
                    
                      
	metrics <- list()

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
	# Iterate through the list of distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    6x
                    
                      
	for (model in c("GUM", "NOR", "LNO", "GEV", "GLO", "GNO", "PE3", "LP3", "WEI")) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
		# Get distribution information

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    54x
                    
                      
		info <- models.info(model)

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
		# Determine the sample L-moments (regular or log)

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    54x
                    
                      
		t3_t4 <- if (info$log) log_t3_t4 else reg_t3_t4

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
		# Compute the L-distance metric directly for two-parameter distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    54x
                    
                      
		if (info$n.params == 2) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    18x
                    
                      
			tau3_tau4 <- lmrxxx(model, c(0, 1))[3:4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    18x
                    
                      
			metrics[[model]] <- distance(tau3_tau4, t3_t4)

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    18x
                    
                      
			next

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
		# Define objective function for three parameter distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    36x
                    
                      
		objective <- function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    608x
                    
                      
			tau3_tau4 <- lmrxxx(model, c(0, 1, i))[3:4]

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    608x
                    
                      
			distance(tau3_tau4, t3_t4)

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
		}

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
		# Run optimization for three parameter distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    36x
                    
                      
		result <- optim(

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    36x
                    
                      
			par = (info$k.bounds[1] + info$k.bounds[2]) / 2,

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    36x
                    
                      
			fn = objective,

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    36x
                    
                      
			method = "Brent",

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    36x
                    
                      
			lower = info$k.bounds[1],

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    36x
                    
                      
			upper = info$k.bounds[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
		)

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    36x
                    
                      
		metrics[[model]] <- result$value

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
	}

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine the recommendation (distribution with lowest L-distance)
