                    81
                    6x
                    
                      
	recommendation <- names(metrics)[which.min(metrics)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the results as a list

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    6x
                    
                      
	list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    6x
                    
                      
		method = "L-distance",

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    6x
                    
                      
		metrics = metrics,

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    6x
                    
                      
		recommendation = recommendation

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
	)	

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Theoretical L-moments of Probability Distributions

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Computes the first four L-moments and L-moment ratios of seven different 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' probability distributions (`GUM`, `NOR`, `GEV`, `GLO`, `GNO`, `PE3`, and `WEI`)

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' given the parameters of the distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @param params Numeric; a vector of parameters. Must have the correct length for the model.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' The distributions `GUM`, `NOR`, `GEV`, `GLO`, and `WEI` have closed-form solutions

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' for the L-moments and L-moment ratios in terms of the parameters. The distributions 

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' `GNO` and `PE3` use rational approximations of the L-moment ratios from Hosking (1997).

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A numeric vector of length 4 containing:

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - \eqn{\lambda_1}: L-mean

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - \eqn{\lambda_2}: L-variance

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - \eqn{\tau_3}: L-skewness

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - \eqn{\tau_4}: L-kurtosis

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @references

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' Hosking, J.R.M. & Wallis, J.R., 1997. Regional frequency analysis: an approach based 

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' on L-Moments. Cambridge University Press, New York, USA.

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' lmrgev(c(0, 1, 0))

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @name lmr-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname lmr-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    2x
                    
                      
lmrgum <- function(params) lmrxxx("GUM", params)

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname lmr-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    2x
                    
                      
lmrnor <- function(params) lmrxxx("NOR", params)

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname lmr-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    2x
                    
                      
lmrgev <- function(params) lmrxxx("GEV", params)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname lmr-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    2x
                    
                      
lmrglo <- function(params) lmrxxx("GLO", params)

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname lmr-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    5x
                    
                      
lmrgno <- function(params) lmrxxx("GNO", params)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname lmr-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    5x
                    
                      
lmrpe3 <- function(params) lmrxxx("PE3", params)

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname lmr-functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    2x
                    
                      
lmrwei <- function(params) lmrxxx("WEI", params)

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
# Generates an informational message about a test

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
test_message <- function(name, reject, p_value, alpha, msg_fail, msg_reject) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    44x
                    
                      
	s1 <- if(reject) "reject the null" else "fail to reject the null"

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    44x
                    
                      
	s2 <- if(reject) msg_reject else msg_fail

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    44x
                    
                      
	l1 <- sprintf("The %s test had a p-value of %.4f.", name, round(p_value, 3))

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    44x
                    
                      
	l2 <- sprintf("At a significance level of %.2f, we %s hypothesis.", alpha, s1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    44x
                    
                      
	l3 <- sprintf("Therefore, there is %s.", s2)

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
	# Combine the messages and add bullet points

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    44x
                    
                      
	paste0("\n - ", c(l1, l2, l3), collapse = "")

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
# Adds sensible axis scales to a plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
add_scales <- function(p) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    11x
                    
                      
	p + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    11x
                    
                      
	scale_x_continuous(breaks = function(limits) pretty(limits, n = 10)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    11x
                    
                      
	scale_y_continuous(breaks = function(limits) pretty(limits, n = 10))

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
# Adds sensible styling to a plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
add_theme <- function(p) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    14x
                    
                      
	p +

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    14x
                    
                      
	theme_minimal() +

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    14x
                    
                      
	theme(

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    14x
                    
                      
		plot.background = element_rect(fill = "white", color = NA),

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    14x
                    
                      
		plot.title = element_text(size = 20, hjust = 0.5),

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    14x
                    
                      
		plot.margin = margin(5, 15, 5, 15),

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    14x
                    
                      
		axis.title = element_text(size = 16),

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    14x
                    
                      
		axis.text = element_text(size = 12),

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    14x
                    
                      
		panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    14x
                    
                      
		legend.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5),

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    14x
                    
                      
		legend.background = element_rect(fill = "white", color = "black"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    14x
                    
                      
		legend.box.background = element_rect(color = "black"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    14x
                    
                      
		legend.direction = "vertical"

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
# Adds a nicely formatted annotation to the top right corner of a plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
add_annotation <- function(p, label) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    2x
                    
                      
	grob <- textGrob(label)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    2x
                    
                      
	rect_w <- 0.22

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    2x
                    
                      
	rect_h <- 0.04

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    2x
                    
                      
	p + annotation_custom(

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    2x
                    
                      
		grob = grobTree(

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    2x
                    
                      
			rectGrob(

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    2x
                    
                      
				x = 0.95 - (rect_w / 2), y = 0.95,

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    2x
                    
                      
				hjust = 0.5, vjust = 0.5,

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    2x
                    
                      
				width = rect_w,

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    2x
                    
                      
				height = rect_h,

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    2x
                    
                      
				gp = gpar(fill = "white", col = "black")

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
			),

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    2x
                    
                      
			textGrob(

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    2x
                    
                      
				label,

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    2x
                    
                      
				x = 0.95 - (rect_w / 2), y = 0.95,

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    2x
                    
                      
				hjust = 0.5, vjust = 0.5 ,

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    2x
                    
                      
				gp = gpar(col = "black", fontsize = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
			)

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
		),

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    2x
                    
                      
		xmin = -Inf, xmax = Inf, ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
# Helper function for getting information about models

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
models.info <- function(model) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    177x
                    
                      
	switch(

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    177x
                    
                      
		model,	

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    177x
                    
                      
		"GUM" = list(n.params = 2, log = FALSE),

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    177x
                    
                      
		"NOR" = list(n.params = 2, log = FALSE),

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    177x
                    
                      
		"LNO" = list(n.params = 2, log =  TRUE),

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    177x
                    
                      
		"GEV" = list(n.params = 3, log = FALSE, k.bounds = c(-9, 9)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    177x
                    
                      
		"GLO" = list(n.params = 3, log = FALSE, k.bounds = c(-0.999, 0.999)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    177x
                    
                      
		"PE3" = list(n.params = 3, log = FALSE, k.bounds = c(-10, 10)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    177x
                    
                      
		"LP3" = list(n.params = 3, log =  TRUE, k.bounds = c(-10, 10)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    177x
                    
                      
		"GNO" = list(n.params = 3, log = FALSE, k.bounds = c(-4, 4)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    177x
                    
                      
		"WEI" = list(n.params = 3, log = FALSE, k.bounds = c(-9, 9)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    177x
                    
                      
		"GUM10" = list(n.params = 3),

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    177x
                    
                      
		"GUM11" = list(n.params = 4),

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    177x
                    
                      
		"NOR10" = list(n.params = 3),

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    177x
                    
                      
		"NOR11" = list(n.params = 4),

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    177x
                    
                      
		"LNO10" = list(n.params = 3),

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    177x
                    
                      
		"LNO11" = list(n.params = 4),

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    177x
                    
                      
		"GEV100" = list(n.params = 4),

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    177x
                    
                      
		"GEV110" = list(n.params = 5),

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    177x
                    
                      
		"GLO100" = list(n.params = 4),

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    177x
                    
                      
		"GLO110" = list(n.params = 5),

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    177x
                    
                      
		"GNO100" = list(n.params = 4),

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    177x
                    
                      
		"GNO110" = list(n.params = 5),

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    177x
                    
                      
		"PE3100" = list(n.params = 4),

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    177x
                    
                      
		"PE3110" = list(n.params = 5),

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    177x
                    
                      
		"LP3100" = list(n.params = 4),

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    177x
                    
                      
		"LP3110" = list(n.params = 5),

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    177x
                    
                      
		"WEI100" = list(n.params = 4),

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    177x
                    
                      
		"WEI110" = list(n.params = 5)

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      
# Helper function for computing covariates. A covariate is a normalized version of 

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      
# the year where 0 corresponds to the first year and 1 is the last year. Covariates

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      
# are used to fit parameters for non-stationary distributions.

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    6813x
                    
                      
get.covariates <- function(years) (years - 1900) / 100

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      
# # Helper function for validaitng parameters passed to a model

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    
                    
                      
# check.parameters <- function(model, params) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    
                    
                      
# 	# List of models with the number of parameters

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    
                    
                      
# 	models.info <- list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    
                    
                      
# 		"GUM"    = 2,

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      
# 		"GUM10"  = 3,

                    		
                  

                  

                    120

                    121

                    122

                    123

                    124

                    125
                    
                    
                      
# 		"LNO10"  = 3,

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    
                    
                      
# 		"LNO11"  = 4,

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    
                    
                      
# 		"GEV"    = 3,

                    		
                  

                  

                    128

                    129

                    130

                    131

                    132

# 		"WEI100" = 4,

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    
                    
                      
# 		"WEI110" = 5

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    
                    
                      
# 	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    146

# 	# Check that params has the correct number of entries

                    		
                  

                  

                    148

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Plot Spearman’s Rho Autocorrelation

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Visualizes Spearman’s rho autocorrelation coefficients with

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' shaded points indicating statistical significance.

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @param results List; autocorrelation coefficients generated by \link{spearman.test}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @return `ggplot`; a plot showing:

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' - Vertical segments from \eqn{y=0} up to each \eqn{\rho} value at its lag.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' - Filled circles at each lag, filled black if serial correlation is detected.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' results <- spearman.test(data)

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' spearman.plot(results)

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @import ggplot2

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
spearman.plot <- function(results) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
	# Create dataframe for generating the results

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    1x
                    
                      
	rho_df <- data.frame(

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    1x
                    
                      
		lag = 1:length(results$rho),

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    1x
                    
                      
		rho = results$rho,

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    1x
                    
                      
		sig = results$sig

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
	# First subplot: Spearman's Rho Autocorrelation

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    1x
                    
                      
	p1 <- ggplot(rho_df, aes(x = .data$lag, y = .data$rho)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    1x
                    
                      
		geom_segment(

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    1x
                    
                      
			aes(x = .data$lag, xend = .data$lag, y = 0, yend = .data$rho)

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
		) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    1x
                    
                      
		geom_point(

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    1x
                    
                      
			aes(fill = .data$sig),

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    1x
                    
                      
			shape = 21,

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    1x
                    
                      
			size = 3,

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    1x
                    
                      
			stroke = 1.2

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
		) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    1x
                    
                      
		labs(

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    1x
                    
                      
			title = "Spearman's Rho Autocorrelation",

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    1x
                    
                      
			x = "Lag",

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    1x
                    
                      
			y = "Spearman's Rho",

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    1x
                    
                      
			fill = "Legend"

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
		) + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    1x
                    
                      
		scale_fill_manual(

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    1x
                    
                      
			values = c(`TRUE` = "black", `FALSE` = "white"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    1x
                    
                      
			labels = c("No Serial Correlation", "Serial Correlation"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
		)

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
	# Return the plot with added theme

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    1x
                    
                      
	add_theme(add_scales(p1))

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
 

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Plot Results from the Pettitt Change‐Point Test

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' Creates a two‐panel visualization of the Mann–Whitney–Pettitt test. The 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' upper panel plots the Pettitt \eqn{U_t} statistic over time along with the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' significance threshold and potential change point. The lower panel displays 

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' the annual maximum streamflow (AMS) data with an optional trend line, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' estimates of the mean, and potential change point.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data Numeric; a vector of annual maximum streamflow data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @param years Numeric; a vector of years with the same length as `data`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @param results List; results of the Pettitt test, generated by \link{pettitt.test}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' @param show_trend Logical; if TRUE (default), draw a fitted line through the AMS data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @return \code{patchwork}; A plot object with two \code{ggplot2} panels stacked vertically.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' results <- pettitt.test(data, years)

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' pettitt.plot(data, years, results)

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{pettitt.test}

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @import ggplot2

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @import patchwork

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
pettitt.plot <- function(data, years, results, show_trend = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
	# Add ut to df and create change point df (if change point is significant)

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    1x
                    
                      
	df <- data.frame(

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    1x
                    
                      
		max = data,

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    1x
                    
                      
		year = years,

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    1x
                    
                      
		ut = results$ut

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    1x
                    
                      
	change_df <- df[results$change.index, ]

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
	# Get the segment endpoints depending on whether there is a change point

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    1x
                    
                      
	n <- length(results$ut)

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    1x
                    
                      
	ends <- if (results$change.index == 0) c(1, n) else c(1, results$change.index, n) 

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    1x
                    
                      
	n_ends <- length(ends)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    1x
                    
                      
	get_segment_mean <- function(i) mean(df$max[ends[i]:ends[i + 1]])

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the segment means for the plot

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    1x
                    
                      
	segment_df <- data.frame(

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    1x
                    
                      
		x = df$year[ends[-n_ends]],            

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    1x
                    
                      
		xend = df$year[ends[-1]],

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    1x
                    
                      
		y = sapply(1:(n_ends - 1), get_segment_mean)

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
	)

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
	# Generate the labels with proper formatting

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    1x
                    
                      
	ut_label <- expression(U[t] ~ Statistic)

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    1x
                    
                      
	flow_label <- expression(AMS ~ m^3/s)

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
	# First subplot: Mann-Whitney-Pettitt Test

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    1x
                    
                      
	p1 <- ggplot(df, aes(x = .data$year, y = .data$ut)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    1x
                    
                      
		geom_line(aes(color = "black"), linewidth = 1.2) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    1x
                    
                      
		geom_hline(

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    1x
                    
                      
			aes(yintercept = results$k.critical, color = "red"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    1x
                    
                      
			linewidth = 1.2,

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    1x
                    
                      
			linetype = "dashed",

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
		) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    1x
                    
                      
		geom_point(data = change_df, aes(color = "blue"), size = 4) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    1x
                    
                      
		labs(

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    1x
                    
                      
			title = "Mann-Whitney-Pettitt Test",

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    1x
                    
                      
			x = "Year",

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    1x
                    
                      
			y = ut_label,

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    1x
                    
                      
			color = "Legend") +

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    1x
                    
                      
		scale_color_manual(

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    1x
                    
                      
			values = c("black" = "black", "red" = "red", "blue" = "blue"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    1x
                    
                      
			breaks = c("black", "red", "blue"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    1x
                    
                      
			labels = c(ut_label, "Change Point Threshold", "Potential Change Point")

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
		)

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
		

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
	# Also plot the original flow data and segment means

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    1x
                    
                      
	p2 <- ggplot(df, aes(x = .data$year, y = max)) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    1x
                    
                      
		geom_point(aes(color = "black"), size = 2.25) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    1x
                    
                      
		(if (show_trend) geom_line(color = "black", linewidth = 1.1) else NULL) + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    1x
                    
                      
		geom_segment(

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    1x
                    
                      
			data = segment_df, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    1x
                    
                      
			aes(x = .data$x, xend = .data$xend, y = .data$y, color = "green4"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    1x
                    
                      
			linewidth = 1.2 

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
		) + 

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    1x
                    
                      
		geom_point(data = change_df, aes(color = "blue"), size = 4) +

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    1x
                    
                      
		labs(x = "Year", y = flow_label, color = "Legend") +

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    1x
                    
                      
		scale_color_manual(

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    1x
                    
                      
			values = c("black" = "black", "green4" = "green4", "blue" = "blue"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    1x
                    
                      
			breaks = c("black", "green4", "blue"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    1x
                    
                      
			labels = c(flow_label, "Segment Mean(s)", "Potential Change Point")

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
		)	

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
	# Stack plots on top of each other and return

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    1x
                    
                      
	add_theme(add_scales(p1)) / add_theme(add_scales(p2))

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Wald–Wolfowitz Runs Test for Randomness

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Applies the Wald–Wolfowitz runs test to a numeric vector of residuals in 

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' order to assess whether they behave as a random sequence. The test statistic’s 

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' p-value is compared to the significance level `alpha`, and a decision is 

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' returned along with a human-readable summary message.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param residuals Numeric; A vector of residuals produced by \link{sens.trend}.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @param alpha Numeric (1); the significance level (default is 0.05).

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @param quiet Logical (1); if FALSE, prints a summary of results (default is TRUE).

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List; test results, including:

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `p.value`: P-value from the Wald–Wolfowitz runs test applied to residuals.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - `residuals`: Numeric vector of residual values from a fitted linear model.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `reject`: Logical. TRUE if the null hypothesis of random residuals is rejected.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - `msg`: Character string summarizing the test result.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' The Wald–Wolfowitz runs test examines the sequence of residuals to test for

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' randomness around the median. A small p-value suggests non-random clustering, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' which may indicate that a linear model is inappropriate for the data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' @references

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' Wald, A. and Wolfowitz, J. (1940). On a test whether two samples are from the 

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' same population. Annals of Mathematical Statistics, 11(2), 147–162.

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @seealso \link{runs.plot}, \link{sens.trend}

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' # Initialize data and years

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' data <- rnorm(n = 100, mean = 100, sd = 10)

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' years <- seq(from = 1901, to = 2000)

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' # Perform the runs test

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' residuals <- sens.trend(data, years)$residuals

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' runs.test(residuals)

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
runs.test <- function(residuals, alpha = 0.05, quiet = TRUE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
	# Remove values from the residuals that are equal to the median

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    6x
                    
                      
	filtered_residuals <- residuals[residuals != median(residuals)]

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
	# Transform the residuals into a boolean vector (TRUE if >median, FALSE if <median)	

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    6x
                    
                      
	boolean_residuals <- (filtered_residuals > median(filtered_residuals))

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
	# Count the number of data points in each category

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    6x
                    
                      
	n <- length(boolean_residuals)

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    6x
                    
                      
	np <- sum(boolean_residuals == TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    6x
                    
                      
	nm <- sum(boolean_residuals == FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine the number of "runs" (contiguous blocks of + or -) in the data

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    6x
                    
                      
	runs <- length(rle(boolean_residuals)$values)

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
	

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the distribution parameters under the null hypothesis

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    6x
                    
                      
	mu <- (2 * np * nm / n) + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    6x
                    
                      
	sigma <- sqrt((2 * np * nm * (2 * np * nm - n)) / ((n^2) * (n - 1)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
	

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
	# Compute the p-value of the two-sided runs test

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    6x
                    
                      
	z <- (runs - mu) / sigma

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    6x
                    
                      
	p_value <- 2 * (1 - pnorm(abs(z)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
	# Determine whether we reject or fail to reject based on p_value and alpha

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    6x
                    
                      
	reject <- (p_value <= alpha)

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
	# Print the results of the test

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    6x
                    
                      
	msg <- test_message(

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    6x
                    
                      
		"runs",

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    6x
                    
                      
		reject,

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    6x
                    
                      
		p_value,

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    6x
                    
                      
		alpha,

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    6x
                    
                      
		"evidence that a linear model is inappropriate.",

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    6x
                    
                      
		"NO evidence that a linear model is inappropriate."

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
	)
